Overview

About PrimeRevenue:

PrimeRevenue is the acknowledged leader in working capital financial technology, optimizing cash flow for more than 20,000 customers in over 70 countries. Last year, more than $200 billion in supply chain transactions were processed through our platform. Headquartered in Atlanta with offices in Prague, London, and Hong Kong, we provide a global reach to best serve customers with local market knowledge and expertise.

Recognized as one of Atlanta’s Best and Brightest Companies to Work For and winner of numerous prestigious industry awards, PrimeRevenue offers a challenging, rewarding, and truly entrepreneurial working environment. We’re an established financial technology industry leader, and we want great people along for the ride. Our TEAM is the most important and integral part of our business. We don’t just offer jobs. We offer careers.

Our people are as diverse as the countries and cultures in which we operate, but they all have one thing in common: they go the extra mile. A position at PrimeRevenue requires a lot of you, but it’s also one that rewards original thinking and hard work. None of us would have it any other way.

Here, you’ll find people who are highly intelligent, motivated, fun-loving and above all, ethical. What really differentiates us from other companies, however, are our Values. We believe they are critical components to hiring and motivating the right individuals and ultimately drive our long-term success. Our values are built upon what we call PRIDE + Integrity -- P erformance, R espect, Innovation, D iversity, E xcellence and, above all, Integrity.

Program term: September 16, 2020 - December 4, 2020 (12 weeks)

Days/Hours : Monday-Friday, part time. A specific schedule will be discussed with your manager and dependent on your availability.

Location: Remote/Virtual

Responsibilities

At PrimeRevenue, our interns and co-ops gain career-related experience in a professional work environment, exposure to different functional areas and departments, and opportunities to apply and integrate academic knowledge and skills. Our TEAM takes pride in a lifetime commitment to positively influence our community and fellow TEAM members, valuing the relationships we form regardless of age or experience.

This internship will be working with our Global Legal TEAM.Scope of work may include:

Technology and structured finance law
Contract law, negotiations, memos
Variety of research projects
Participation in client calls and conversations, sales negotiations, contract creation and negotiation


Qualifications

Candidates must be pursuing a graduate degree at an accredited law school
Must have internet access
Excellent written, verbal and communication skills in English, other languages a plus
Exceptional attention to detail
International Business, International Transactions, Structured Finance, Investment or Commercial Banking, or Computer Science interest/background a plus


Options

Apply for this job online Apply

Share

Email this job to a friend Refer

Job Description:Reinvent yourself at Leidos! Uncover your potential by becoming a member of our team.The Leidos Tactical Solutions Team in Littleton, Colorado is growing and looking for you, our new Software Engineer Intern performing cutting edge software development and systems integration. If you are looking for career development and growth opportunities, both technically and professionally and to have fun, all while supporting our nations heroes, there is no better spot for you! This team is growing rapidly and is looking for a highly motivated, fun-loving, techie to fill this key role!This internship will be part-time during school year and full-time during summer or school breaks.These are some of the cool things you will be doing:Software Engineering across the entire lifecycle including requirements, design, development and integration, testing, demonstration with the end-user/customer, and operational support.Growing your skillset through mentoring and training opportunities.Other assignments as determined by the lead engineer or Manager.To be successful in this role you must have the following:Go-getter mentality, ability to wear multiple hats, learn quickly, team-playerCurrently enrolled in a undergraduate degree program. Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or related majors preferred.Object Oriented Software Development using JavaAndroid Mobile Development experienceAbility to attain Secret Security Clearance- US citizenship requiredYou will wow us even more if you have experience with any of the following:Familiarity with Agile development practicesTactical Assault Kit / Team Awareness Kit (TAK) Development & IntegrationUnity development experienceExperience with modern web framework (e.g. Angular, React)Object Oriented Software Development using C++Prior military experienceExternal Referral Bonus:IneligiblePotential for Telework:NoClearance Level Required:NoneTravel:NoScheduled Weekly Hours:40Shift:DayRequisition Category:InternJob Family:Intern TechnicalLeidos is a Fortune 500® information technology, engineering, and science solutions and services leader working to solve the world's toughest challenges in the defense, intelligence, homeland security, civil, and health markets. The company's 33,000 employees support vital missions for government and commercial customers. Headquartered in Reston, Virginia, Leidos reported annual revenues of approximately $10.19 billion for the fiscal year ended December 28, 2018. For more information, visit www.Leidos.com.Pay and benefits are fundamental to any career decision. That's why we craft compensation packages that reflect the importance of the work we do for our customers. Employment benefits include competitive compensation, Health and Wellness programs, Income Protection, Paid Leave and Retirement. More details are available here.Leidos will never ask you to provide payment-related information at any part of the employment application process. And Leidos will communicate with you only through emails that are sent from a Leidos.com email address. If you receive an email purporting to be from Leidos that asks for payment-related information or any other personal information, please report the email to spam.leidos@leidos.com.All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, ethnicity, age, national origin, citizenship, religion, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, pregnancy, family structure, marital status, ancestry, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law. Leidos will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with relevant laws.

Noblis is seeking qualified technical interns for fall and winter of 2020.

Guided And Mentored By Our Expert Staff (including Former Interns), Noblis Interns Augment Their Classroom Learning With Hands-on Project Work In

Machine Learning
Artificial Intelligence
Data Analytics
Computer Science
Autonomous Systems
Life and Chemical/Biological Sciences

Your contributions will make an enduring impact supporting our Noblis Sponsored Research Program. The NSR program is a vital and essential part of corporate life at Noblis. Our yearly investment in this program, along with our ethical practices and code of conduct, is part of what makes us the unique nonprofit organization that we are. Noblis research is the forward-thinking seed that generates not only larger corporate work programs and roles, but also sound, sustainable solutions with enduring impacts.

Our NSR projects demonstrate the art of the possible to our clients. They enable us to create new intellectual capital and capabilities and to develop new thinking and models that will help us solve critical problems that our clients will face in the future. Noblis research allows us to expand staff capabilities and provides an interesting outlet for the creative and inventive spirit found throughout Noblis.

Noblis is consistently recognized as a “Great Place to Work” and “One of the Best Mid-Sized Companies to Work For" by Glassdoor, Entrepreneur and The Great Place to Work Institute. Noblis was recognized as the top ranked government contractor on the Washington Post's Top Workplaces listing, for the seventh year in a row.

What You Bring To The Table

Proof of U.S. citizenship or permanent residency;
A GPA of 3.3 or higher in your undergraduate, graduate or doctoral studies;
Demonstrated analytical skills, strong written and oral communication skills and team work skills.
Availability to work part-time supporting some of the market’s leading-edge technologies

Fall and Winter interns can be eligible to participate in our 2021 summer internship following their completion of the fall program.

Noblis and our wholly owned subsidiary, Noblis ESI , are solving difficult problems that help our government and our country. We bring the best of scientific thought, management, and engineering expertise with a reputation for independence and objectivity. We support a wide range of government and industry clients in the areas of national security, intelligence, transportation, healthcare, environmental sustainability, and enterprise engineering. Learn more at Noblis -About Us

Why work at a Noblis company?

Our employees find greater meaning in their work and balance the other things in life that matter to them. Our people are our greatest asset. They are exceptionally skilled, knowledgeable, team-oriented, and mission-driven individuals who want to do work that matters and benefits the public.

Noblis has won numerous workplace awards . Noblis maintains a drug-free workplace and is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

We’re looking for students who have a passion for technology and who enjoy working with data.




The Data Analyst intern will be provided mentoring and career-related experience by working with our Salesforce Controller, Sales & Marketing teams! We tailor the learning objectives to you!

This semester-long internship will commence in the Fall of 2020 and will be fully virtual.




*Please note that this is an unpaid internship, course credit could be awarded depending on the course requirements.




Intern Tasks:

• Work closely with our Salesforce Controller, Sales & Marketing team to complete challenging projects.

• Collaborate with different team members to make valuable connections by the end of the internship.

• Open the door to new ways of thinking and working to improve everyone’s work processes.




What we offer you:

•Mentorship and hands-on experience in your area of study.

•Professional Networking opportunities.

•Fun tech company culture even virtually!







Qualifications:

To be considered for this position the applicant must be actively enrolled in a college or university as a full-time student seeking a bachelor’s degree or higher. Preferably a student working toward a bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Economics, or Mathematics.




•    Effective written & verbal communication skills.

•    Analytical problem-solving skills.

•    Experience with Report Development is a plus.

•    Familiarity with Analysis and Strategic Planning.

•    Familiarity with Salesforce CRM if preferred but we will teach you the basics.

•    Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Programs (especially Excel).

•    Familiarity with Google Docs is a plus.

•    A team player attitude is a must!

Lightfox Games is a mobile game developer based in Seattle, Washington. We aim to make the best multiplayer games that connect and inspire the next generation of mobile players.




We are looking for an energetic and versatile Unity Development Intern who is excited to learn and develop an amazing experience for our players. If you have a passion for game development and want to participate in the future of Lightfox Games, we would love to hear from you!




We are building a company of collaborative game makers with the power to do what they think is best for our games, community, and company.




Our ideal Unity Development Intern will work closely with our Head of Engineering to design and implement Unity-based UI, gameplay, and tooling. You could be streamlining our prefab structure, authoring UI tooling, implementing UI, or implementing a new gameplay feature! The ideal candidate should be comfortable in various aspects of Unity development.




We are a small startup so you must be willing to work hard and do cool stuff!




Responsibilities

Communicate with other team members to establish effective pipeline and integrate assets
Work with artists, designers, and engineers to implement Unity-based features and supporting those features through tooling as needed
Implement user interface screens, transitions, animations, and VFX
Support content creation pipelines, tool development, and workflow improvements 
Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable code
Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to address these problems
Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization




Requirements

Strong, proven programming skills (C#, .NET Core and Standard as well as Typescript and/or Javascript)
Sample Unity project we can download and play for either PC or mobile.
1+ years working with the Unity platform in gaming or interaction design field
Experience with Unity specific performance analysis and code optimization
Understand the core challenges of Unity mobile development
Ability to work well within a dynamic, cross-discipline, and iterative team environment
Self-motivated, collaborative, excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Positive attitude and an ability to receive and provide objective feedback
Excellent written and verbal communications skills




Pluses

Bachelor or Master degree in Computer Science, related field or equivalent experience
Experience with Socket.io backends
Experience authoring custom editors, inspectors, and tooling within Unity
Working knowledge of common UI technical architecture and patterns, with an emphasis on the Unity specific implementations of UI
Real passion for mobile games, and/or games industry experience
iOS and/or Android software development experience




Required Application Materials

Resume
Cover Letter
Sample Unity project we can download and play for either PC or mobile

Now’s our time to inspire the future of healthcare together.

At Siemens Healthineers, we are passionate about enabling healthcare professionals to deliver high quality patient care, and to do so affordably. A leading global healthcare company, Siemens Healthineers continues to strengthen our portfolio of medical imaging and laboratory diagnostics, while adding new offerings such as managed services, consulting, and healthcare IT services – as well as further technologies in the growing market for therapeutic and molecular diagnostics.

Siemens Healthineers develops innovations that support better patient outcomes with greater efficiencies, giving providers the confidence, they need to meet the clinical, operational and financial challenges of a changing healthcare landscape. Join our team now at Siemens Healthineers as a Design Engineering Co-Op.

As a Design Engineering Co-Op, You Will Be Responsible For

This is a role well suited to an ambitious professional, looking for the next step in their career.

Research into software and hardware for machine learning and object detection related to medical ultrasound. Evaluating various object detection algorithms with the idea of modifying and enhancing them for ultrasound. Work with a senior analog designer to design, develop, implement, debug and test the algorithms.

This position is an opportunity to learn design and implementation techniques from a senior design engineer with 30+ years of experience in analog and system architecture design. The candidate will at times be expected to discover and use methods on their own. Experience with Python, neural networks, and machine learning preferred.

Required skills to have for the success of this role

Must be currently enrolled in a Bachelor’s program (rising junior or senior) with a minimum GPA of 3.2 or higher
Desired majors: computer science and electrical engineering or equivalent degree; experience with artificial intelligence, image processing and machine learning preferred
Must be available to work 40 hours/week from September 2020 – March 2021; part-time availability possible based on candidate/academic schedule

Start date: September 2020; 6 month duration

At Siemens Healthineers, we value those who dedicate their energy and passion to a greater cause. Our people make us unique as an employer in the med-tech industry. What unites and motivates our global team is the inspiration of our common purpose: To innovate for healthcare, building on our remarkable legacy of pioneering ideas that translate into even better healthcare products and services. We recognize that taking ownership of our work allows both us and the company to grow. We offer you a flexible and dynamic environment and the space to move beyond your comfort zone to grow both personally and professionally.

If you want to join us in transforming the way healthcare is delivered, visit our career site at https://usa.healthcare.siemens.com/careers

If you wish to find out more about the specific before applying, please visit: https://usa.healthcare.siemens.com/about.

As an equal-opportunity employer we are happy to consider applications from individuals with disabilities.

Work with broad range of AWS & Azure services like EC2, VM, cloudwatch, monitor, lambda, functions etc. to support internal business solutions

Work with event based and Serverless architecture leveraging APIs in various platforms and tools and building integration to automate processes

Support creating and managing applications using Office 365 PowerApps, SharePoint, Teams and in scripting languages like PowerShell, Bash
Understanding and experience with terraform, Infrastructure as Code, CI/CD processes, Git, Azure DevOps, AWS SDKs, Azure SDKs, scripting languages like python & databse technologies like SQL or NoSQL preferred

Overview

SoftwareONE is a global technology services company and Microsoft’s largest technology services partner in the world. With the recent trends around the many challenges of managing global markets, increased competition, higher consumer expectations and a broadening mobile work force, our customer’s must change the way they operate, and challenge the traditional role of IT. More than ever, CIOs and IT directors need to think and act strategically, provide agile IT services, champion innovation and disrupt markets. These capabilities are critical for business growth and success.

SoftwareONE Technology Services help our customers to realize their vision with greater clarity and confidence. We achieve this through helping them understand the value of their software portfolio investment, strategic advisory services, and supporting the customers’ business transformation with world-class professional delivery services to provide a cloud-enabled future.

At SoftwareONE, we understand the fast-paced demands of cross-border business. We work seamlessly between countries, cultures and languages, providing the best resources to achieve our customer’s business drivers and outcomes.

The SoftwareONE culture ensures that innovation and creativity is at the heart of everything we do.

Globally headquartered in Stands, Switzerland with a local presence in 85+ countries, our 5,500+ technology experts help our customers get full business value out of all aspects of their software portfolio. We leverage our extensive technical and commercial expertise, strong product knowledge, and close relationships, with all main publishers, such as Microsoft, Adobe, IBM, VMware, Oracle, RedHat, Citrix, AWS, Symantec, McAfee, and many more.

Success at SoftwareONE isn’t defined by what you do for yourself, but by what you deliver for our customers, the business and for the employees around you.

Our internship program includes a comprehensive learning path and mentorship from our leaders to ensure that you integrate with the team successfully. Through local office corporate immersion, inclusion, and networking opportunities, we can guide you through building a strong sense of community. We are also committed to providing you varied experiences that will help you expand your skill set and broaden your exposure to the full portfolio that SoftwareONE has to offer. You will have the opportunity to work on complex emerging technology, as well as, business projects across a wide range of fields and industries.

Through technical immersion, training and hands-on-the-job experiences, we focus on your personal and professional growth, challenging you to stretch your boundaries and achieve your greatest potential.

Assist in designing and implementing platform and custom-designed solutions for our customers’ technology requirements
Brainstorming sessions with clients to design solution architectures to meet their everchanging business needs
Assist in building Proof of Concept for new or emerging technologies at a customer site
Investigate, document and assist in implementing complex technical solutions within the Technical Services delivery consultants
Assist in automating technical tasks
Convert technical notes to standardized reports, charts, diagrams and workflows
Interested and passionate about technology and learning
Good work ethic, ability to independently and effectively manage time
Desire to take initiative and ownership of daily work
Good customer service skills required
Highly motivated and results oriented
Ability to read, analyze and write technical documentation and how-to guides
Ability to develop and design process documentation and flowcharts
Verbally communicate precisely, effectively and with confidence to both individuals and 1:many
Part-time, up to 30 hours a week
Extracurricular/volunteering experience is a plus
Computer Information Systems, Computer Science, Data Science and Math majors preferred
Experience with Microsoft business productivity products, including Office and Windows
Experience with PowerShell and Microsoft SQL Server is desired
Minimum 3.0 GPA preferred

Smart people. Great clients. A culture that fosters innovation, teamwork and professional enrichment. These are just a few reasons why so many individuals have built long and lucrative careers with IDeaS. That next individual could be you.




Since 1989, IDeaS has been helping the world’s hospitality businesses maximize their revenue performance. IDeaS Revenue Solutions - a SAS Company, offers industry-leading pricing and revenue management Software, Services, and Consulting to the hospitality and travel industries. We've been called on by industries as far-ranging as parking, airlines, transportation and event ticketing.




Headquartered in Minneapolis, MN with our Global Technology center located in Pune, India, IDeaS maintains sales, support and distribution offices in North & South America, the United Kingdom, Europe, Middle East, Africa, Australia and Asia. No matter what we're working on, our goal is to make revenue management so user-friendly, insightful, and profitable that revenue management professionals wouldn't think of going back to the old way of doing things.



 



Smart people. Great clients. A culture that fosters innovation, teamwork and professional enrichment. These are just a few reasons why so many individuals have built long and lucrative careers with IDeaS. That next individual could be you.



 



Summary:
As a member of the IDeaS Software Development team you will participate in all aspects of the software development lifecycle. You will join a delivery team that is actively creating new features to enhance our revenue management products. While on our team, you will have a great opportunity to expand your technical skillset as well as work in an agile environment at believes in test-first, continuous integration and deployment. Some of the technologies we use are: Spring (core, integration, batch, etc.), AWS (ECS, Fargate, SQS, Lambda, Serverless, many more), Angular, Java EE (EJB/JMS /JPA), Vaadin, JAXB, REST, SOAP, SQL Server, MongoDB, Jenkins, Sonar as well as many others.



 



Major Responsibilities:
• Design and develop Java web application features
• Produce necessary technical documentation.
• Performs other duties, as assigned.



 



Requirements:
• Planned degree in Computer Science, EE or CE (undergraduate or graduate)
• Completed at least 2 years of undergraduate degree in targeted degree
• 3.0 or above GPA.
• Experience with Java or JVM supported languages (Groovy, Scala, JRuby, Clojure, etc) either via coursework or industry experience



 



Other:
• Flexibility in work hours to manage interaction with geographically distributed employees, vendors and/or partners
• Work is typically performed in an office environment, using simple, easy muscular movements, involving only the handling of light materials, tools, or equipment in easy work positions, and with no special speed requirements or long stretches of exertion.
• Vision requirements for this job include close vision and the ability to adjust focus.



 



Want to stay up to date with IDeaS culture, products and jobs? Follow us on LinkedIn

Additional Information:
To qualify, applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States, and should not require, now or in the future, sponsorship for employment visa status.
SAS is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. Read more: Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law. Also view the supplement EEO is the Law, and the notice Pay Transparency

Resumes may be considered in the order they are received.



 



IDeaS/SAS employees performing certain job functions may require access to technology or software subject to export or import regulations. To comply with these regulations, IDeaS/SAS may obtain nationality or citizenship information from applicants for employment. IDeaS/SAS collects this information solely for trade law compliance purposes and does not use it to discriminate unfairly in the hiring process.

ROLE

• Work on porting/writing ML algorithms with Python notebooks on http://cainvas.ai-tech.systems/

• Seek interesting and meaningful ML problems for smart city, smart health and IoT verticals.




QUALIFICATION

• Enrolled in BS/MS/PhD in Computer Science or Computer Engineering

Program

• Has a certification in deep learning MOOC

• Experienced in writing/porting machine learning notebooks with Python, TernsorFlow, PyTorch and other frameworks

• You would need strong Python programming and basic math skills.




NICE TO HAVE

• Experience with popular Neural Network Graph structure.

• Experience on embedded development.

• Ability to collaborate well with others in an energizing environment.

Summary Of Role

As part of process design kits (PDKs) QA team, you will be developing QA automation with emphasis on LVS, Layout parasitic extraction (PEX) and EMIR flows using Cadence, Mentor, Synopsys and Ansys EDA software

Essential Responsibilities

Develop test structures for Parasitic Extraction and ElectroMigration and IR drop analysis of different CMOS and RF technologies
Develop and enhance automated QA procedures to improve the efficiency and integrity of the design kits
Analyze QA data to generate detailed reports to highlight test results
Perform continuous integration and build automation for QA regression using Jenkins


Required Qualifications

Enrolled in BS/MS in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or other relevant technical discipline
At least two years of experience (including course work) in Software development (EDA or Semiconductor related is a plus)
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Proven skills in automation (Jenkins) and programming languages (SKILL, Perl, Python, Tcl, shell script)
Detailed oriented, well organized and a team player
Travel – (0% of travel required)
Language Fluency – English


Preferred Qualifications

Previous Semiconductor experience
Working knowledge of industry standard EDA tools for LVS, Layout parasitic extraction and Electromigration and IR Drop analysis (EMIR) flows


If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please contact us by email at usaccommodations@globalfoundries.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. Requests for accommodation will be considered on a case-by-case basis. Please note that only inquiries concerning a request for reasonable accommodation will be responded to from this email address.

An offer of employment with GLOBALFOUNDRIES is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background check and drug screen, as applicable and subject to applicable laws and regulations.

GLOBALFOUNDRIES is fully committed to equal opportunity in the workplace and believes that cultural diversity within the company enhances its business potential. GLOBALFOUNDRIES goal of excellence in business necessitates the attraction and retention of highly qualified people. Artificial barriers and stereotypic biases detract from this objective and may be illegally discriminatory.

Procedure: All policies and processes which pertain to employees including recruitment, selection, training, utilization, promotion, compensation, benefits, extracurricular programs, and termination are created and implemented without regard to age, ethnicity, ancestry, color, marital status, medical condition, mental or physical disability, national origin, race, religion, political and/or third-party affiliation, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other characteristic or category specified by local, state or federal law.

Summary Of Role

The objective of the internship/Co-Op project is to develop applications that utilizes machine learning algorithms and present actionable insights from extremely large amounts of manufacturing data. The Intern will be exposed to state of the art AWS infrastructure and machine learning software. This internship position will be based out of and support our Santa Clara, California location.

Essential Responsibilities

Application of unsupervised machine learning algorithms on large amounts of defect data to capture anomalies and clusters
Innovate and be willing to try different things while driving clear value from unorganized data.
Analyze data from machine learning software packages to quantify the application in terms of business impact.
Learn how to manipulate data on a large scale and how to efficiently store pattern images in an effective manner.
Perform all activities in a safe and responsible manner and support all Environmental, Health, Safety & Security requirements and programs


Required Qualifications

Education – MS Student enrolled in an accredited program in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, Computer Science, Physics, or related fields.
Experience – Minimum of 3 months programming experience with ML applications e.g, PCA for clustering, Density estimation for anomaly detection, neural network for supervised learning.
Be able to thrive in an uncertain and fast changing environment with a clear focus on the final goal.
Relentless drive to innovate as well as risk taking ability to do things differently.
Self-motivated; able to take ownership of assignments, develop work plans and proactively seek feedback to ensure objectives are aligned and met.
Team player; able to succeed in a dynamic, fast paced environment.
Travel – None
Language Fluency – English
Physical Capacity Demands – None


Preferred Qualifications

Statistical background.
Working experience in AWS infrastructure such as Sagemaker will be preferred.
Experience in developing web based application with strong user interface development skills will be preferred.
Comfortable working in UNIX environments, knowledge of UNIX commands.

SUMMARY The Information Technology Internship is designed to provide well rounded exposure to IT functions while fulfilling work assignments in a support capacity. This Chickasaw Nation Industries (CNI) IT Cybersecurity Intern position supports various aspects of business projects with emphasis placed on cybersecurity while also assisting with other departmental duties, as assigned. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Essential duties and responsibilities include the following. Responsible for the integration of CNI Core Competencies into daily functions, including: commitment to integrity, knowledge / quality of work, supporting financial goals of the company, initiative / motivation, cooperation / relationships, problem analysis / discretion, accomplishing goals through organization, positive oral / written communication skills, leadership abilities, commitment to Affirmative Action, reliability / dependability, flexibility and ownership / accountability of actions taken. Effectively communicates and translates highly technical information in a professional manner at all levels, including executives. Supports the technical execution of Information Security programs such as Incident Response and Event Monitoring. Researches and prepares periodic and ad-hoc reports of Information Security program execution. Develops and maintains documentation for supported processes and procedures. Performs ongoing research of Information Security related topics. Performs a variety of assigned tasks under supervisory guidance. Operates formalized Information Security programs and processes such as Vulnerability Management, Third Party Assessments, System Hardening and Security Requests Assists with planning and executing IT and business projects. Performs business analysis, project management and administrative assignments. Conducts information gathering sessions. Takes detailed notes, analyzes data, creates flowcharts / documentation, and creates final reports in various formats. Assists in the design, configuration, testing, training, deployment and support of strategic projects within the cybersecurity realm of responsibilities. Will participate in projects and meetings with IT leaders on cybersecurity matters. Responsible for aiding in own self-development by being available and receptive to all training made available by the company. Plans daily activities within the guidelines of company policy, job description and supervisors instruction in such a way as to maximize personal output. Responsible for keeping own immediate work area in a neat and orderly condition to ensure safety of self and coworkers. Will report any unsafe conditions and/or practices to the appropriate supervisor and human resources. Will immediately correct any unsafe conditions to the best of own ability. EDUCATION / EXPERIENCE Must be enrolled or accepted for enrollment in a relevant college degree program at the time the internship will be served - either at the graduate or upper undergraduate level. Enrollment in a Computer Science or Information Technology degree program is preferred. Background check may be conducted. Must have an acceptable GPA. Strong understanding of TCP/IP networking including knowledge of protocols, ports, and services Forensic analysis experience or administrator level knowledge of Windows, Mac, and Linux systems. IT Network or Security Operation Center experience. Experience in computer network defense and in-depth technical knowledge/mastery with intrusion detection systems. Experience monitoring network traffic (i.e. netflow and PCAP) and IDS/IPS data. Experience with log analysis, event correlation and incident management procedures and systems. Experience with Windows Client and Server OS Experience with Redhat and CentOS Linux platforms. CERTIFICATES / LICENSES / REGISTRATION JOB SPECIFIC KNOWLEDGE / SKILLS / ABILITIES Basic understanding of Information Security roles and responsibilities Excellent computer skills with proficiency using Microsoft Windows and Office programs (i.e., Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, etc.) Excellent written and verbal communications skills with knowledge and ability to utilize appropriate grammatical skills Must have aptitude for learning, be self-directed, and be capable of working in a fast-paced operations environment Ability to create professional reports, flowcharts and documentation utilizing various formats Ability to work and communicate effectively with all levels of management and coworkers, as well as a wide range of people having diverse backgrounds Ability to employ a customer service approach and to present technical information with clarity to non-technical users Ability to maintain confidentiality of sensitive information Ability to be dependable and to meet schedules / timelines Ability to prioritize projects and services for minimum user interruption and downtime Well organized, detail-oriented and self-motivated Ability to work effectively both independently and in a team environment LANGUAGE SKILLS Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations. Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals. Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public. MATHEMATICAL SKILLS Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commissions, proportions, and percentages. Ability to apply concepts of basic algebra and geometry. Financial background helpful. REASONING ABILITY Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables. PHYSICAL DEMANDS The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to perform successfully the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this job. Work is primarily performed in an office environment. Regularly required to sit. Regularly required use hands to finger, handle, or feel, reach with hands and arms to handle objects and operate tools, computer, and/or controls. Required to speak and hear. Occasionally required to stand, walk and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. Must frequently lift and/or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus. Exposed to general office noise with computers printers and light traffic. If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us

About The Position

The NOC Intern will assist the Network Operations Center Team in ensuring the operational success of Logicworks’ clients and internal teams by monitoring backups, assisting with client communication, creating formal documentation processes, as well as tracking internal ticket progress. You’ll work with cutting-edge technologies, assist with innovative products, and learn from some of the most talented engineers in the industry. This would be a great opportunity for current students to gain valuable experience and understanding of the inner workings of the software development process of a premier managed IT services provider, and the skills needed to be successful.

The internship is intended for rising college juniors and seniors with an interest in pursuing a career within a high-tech IT company. A successful intern may be considered for a full-time position on our NOC team.

The internship will average 40 hours per week during normal business hours and is scheduled to run from 4-6 months. You will be based remotely out of your home office reporting into our NYC Headquarters at 155 Avenue of the Americas, New York, NY 10013.

What You’ll Do

Perform daily backup analysis
Utilize our internal ticketing system, to create, monitor, and update tickets for our clients
Assist with scheduling client maintenances
Create technical documentation & drive operational process improvement
Compile server utilization reports to help clients with capacity planning
Assist with client communication
Assist Service Delivery Managers with client audits
Assist with monitoring client’s environment via our internal monitoring tools



Desired Skills And Experience

Pursuing a degree in Computer Science, IT or Engineering
High attention to detail
Familiarity with Linux/Unix and/or Windows Administration
Excellent customer service and strong written/verbal communication skills
Ability and curiosity to learn a full range of technology platforms and data network systems as well as apply new skills rapidly
And most importantly - a passion for emerging technologies!



About Logicworks

Logicworks has been helping customers achieve operational excellence and compliance on the cloud for over six years. Our innovative platform, dedicated certified engineers, and decades of traditional IT experience combine to enable our customer’s success across every stage of the cloud journey. Companies in regulated industries across healthcare, financial services, and SaaS rely on our compliance expertise and unique combination of maturity and innovation to help them scale securely, automate compliance, and gain efficiencies in private and public clouds. Logicworks is an AWS Premier Consulting Partner with seven competencies and a Microsoft Azure Expert Managed Services Provider. We are recognized in the Leadership Category of Gartner’s Magic Quadrant for Public Cloud Infrastructure Professional and Managed Services and voted as a winner in the 2018 & 2019 Best & Brightest Companies to Work for in the Nation competition.

Security Responsibilities

All members of Logicworks are responsible for security of their workstation and mobile devices; this includes:

Good password practices,
Safe browsing
Keeping your devices up to date with security patches – Operating System and Application
Locking one’s screen when away
Physically protecting your devices when in public or high-risk areas.
Attending annual Security Awareness training


All staff is also responsible for adherence and compliance with all Logicworks Security Policy, including but not limited to:

All Policies contained within the policy package, reviewed and signed.
All regulatory or compliance policy which is applicable to employee role and responsibilities.


We are committed to a policy of Equal Employment Opportunity and will not discriminate on any legally recognized basis, including, but not limited to, race, age, color, religion, sex, marital status, national origin, citizen, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status or any other basis recognized by federal, state or local law.

Categories:Biomedical - Imaging and Optics, Biomedical Engineering

Yale University has multiple research positions open for PET/CT and SPECT/CT imaging research projects. Such positions include post-doctoral fellows, PhD/MS graduate students, and internships. Self-funded visiting scholars and exchange students are welcome to apply.
The candidates will be exposed to a unique training and research environment supported by multiple NIH and Industrial grants and strong Academic-Industrial Partnerships. Research projects will focus on developing dose-reduction techniques and motion correction methods for PET/CT, and advanced imaging methods for cardiac SPECT applications, as well as Deep Learning based approaches for pre-processing and post-processing.
Applicants should have a background in electrical engineering, biomedical engineering, medical physics, computer science, or a related field. Strong analytical, programming, and experimental skills are essential. Experience in deep learning, image reconstruction, algorithm development, or image analysis is highly desirable.
Interested individuals should send a C.V., letter of interest, and contacts of three references by email to Dr. Chi Liu (), Associate Professor of Radiology and Biomedical Imaging.

Habana Labs is hiring Software Engineering Intern to scale up its AI testing and integration. This position collaborates with internal teams to understand their testing and integration requirements and build and maintain a testing/integration solution at scale. Responsibilities include developing and maintaining component, system, and integration tests and frameworks at scale which are close to hardware.

We're looking for someone who can be a self-starter with the drive to learn and make a positive technological impact in a rapidly developing and exciting field.


Selected candidates should be available to work remotely full time through end of year


Qualifications

You must possess minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Experience listed below would be obtained through a combination of your school work/classes/research and/or relevant previous job and/or internship experiences.

Requirements

Pursuing a MS in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, Electrical Engineering, or related field.

8+ months experience with:

Developing software close to hardware and experience with C required
Accelerators and/or asynchronous programming required.
Experience with Golang.
Experience with standard open-source developer workflows (git, Jenkins, code reviews, ...) required.
Understanding of the unique challenges that testing and integrating complex systems pose.
Ability to assess both component details while retaining perspective of the full software stack.


Additional Requirements

Experience with scale-out programming technologies is astrong plus.
Experience with machine learning frameworks (PyTorch and/or Tensorflow) and their use in data science is astrong plus.
Open-source developer background is a plus.



Inside this Business Group

The Data Center Group (DCG) is at the heart of Intel’s transformation from a PC company to a company that runs the cloud and billions of smart, connected computing devices. The data center is the underpinning for every data-driven service, from artificial intelligence to 5G to high-performance computing, and DCG delivers the products and technologies—spanning software, processors, storage, I/O, and networking solutions—that fuel cloud, communications, enterprise, and government data centers around the world.

position: 2020-2021 Student Writers - Lions Pride Media Group
description:
Job Description Summary

The Lions' Pride Media Group will be filling the following positions:

Staff Writers for Print & Digital
Copy Editors for Print & Digital
Designers and Artists for Print
Photographers and Videographers
Multimedia Writers/Creators/Designers (video, audio, slide shows, etc.)
Digital Designers and Computer Programmers for online media
Advertising and Fundraising Representatives
Social Media Writers and Designers
Possible positions once writing skills are proven: bloggers and podcasters.

Job Description

Student journalists research and write stories for national, regional and local press. They report on campus news, politics, sports, arts and entertainment, science and business. They also cover national and local events, entertainment and human interest stories. Staff writers/content creators usually write stories allocated to them by the news desk. They pass these to their page editor, who in turn work with them to edit/proofread the written/created material before publication.
Occasionally, there is the need for an editor position to be filled, these are usually filled by students who have worked for The Lions' Pride Media Group for at least one year. You may contact Dr. Kasper at valerie.kasper@saintleo.edu to inquire about these positions.

Qualifications

Strong vocabulary, spelling and grammar skills, and a knowledge of writing. Otherwise, a willingness to learn these skills is needed.
Strong organizational and time management skills needed to balance work with school.
The ability to work effectively in a team environment. The ability to assist other teammates and work when necessary to accomplish the goals of a weekly newspaper.
Good communication skills needed to communicate with those who are interviewed for the differing media needs of the differing media platforms.
Must be dependable, self-motivated, and able to work under pressure, meet weekly deadlines, and possess good communication skills with team members.
Knowledge of digital photography and downloading photos preferred, but not required.
Ability to use (or willingness to learn) InDesign, Photoshop, and Microsoft Word. Adobe Premier Video Editing not required, but an added bonus.

Essential Functions

Cover campus news, breaking news, feature stories, general news, meetings, sports events, and more. These events can be at any time of day or night.
Write weekly articles, take photos, shoot video, attend events, and other essential needs to complete assignments.
Develop ideas for stories and questions, contact interviewees for interviews, and communicate effectively to obtain interviews and follow through with them.
Attend weekly meetings, which are mandatory, unless class conflicts.

position: Energy Projects, Applications, Service Engineering - Technical Projects Internship (Fall 2020)
description:
Disclaimer: This position is expected to start around September 2020 and continue through the entire Fall semester (i.e. December 2020) or into early 2021 if available. Please consider availability before submitting an application.

Internship Program at Tesla

The University Recruiting Team is driven by the passion to recognize emerging talent. Our year around program places the best students in positions that they will grow both technically and personally through their experience working closely with their Manager, Mentor, and team. We are dedicated to providing an experience that allows for the intern to experience life at Tesla by given them projects that are critical to their team’s success.

Instead of going on coffee runs and making copies, you’ll be seated at the table making critical decisions that will influence not only your team, but the overall achievement of Tesla’s mission.

About The Teams

The Tesla Energy Projects team is responsible for the successful deployment and management of Tesla’s cutting edge Energy Storage Systems; Powerwall, Powerpack, Megapack, Solar, Solar Roof, Supercharger.

We’re looking for a driven, motivated and collaborative engineers to join us to help accelerate the works transition to sustainable energy. As part of the team you’ll work across the organization, solving problems to ensure the success of our products.

As You Continue To Discover Your Passion And Strengths In Navigating Your Career Path, You Can Be Part Of One Of Our Internship Programs Within The Following Energy Projects Engineering Teams

Power Systems Modelling: Focused on modelling the impact that Tesla’s Energy Storage Systems will have on the power grid and working with customers on system modelling and interconnection studies.
Project Deployment: Be part of the team that puts projects in the ground; the project deployment team is responsible for managing Tesla’s project deployments on a day-to-day basis.
Project Design: Responsible for delivering best in class project designs and templates for Tesla’s Solar and Energy Storage projects
Application Engineering: Figuring out how to successfully manage Tesla’s Microgrids is one of the jobs of the Application engineering team; Applications Engineering solves many of the SCADA and controls problems our customers face.
Project Engineering: Working with customers throughout the project lifecycle, the Project Engineering team touches all parts of the Tesla Energy product and project offering from sales engineering through commissioning.
Service Engineering: Responsible for the maintenance of the Fleet Health of Tesla’s deployed Energy Storage and Supercharger fleets using data engineering and first principles product knowledge.


General Requirements

Currently working towards a degree in a relevant program such as Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Physics, Construction Management or Mechatronics
Be able to complete a 12 -week internship program
Relocate to Palo Alto, CA
Must be self-managed and committed to working in a fast-paced environment
Partner alongside engineers and various cross functional team members to build, manage, perform and support various aspects of real time projects
Develop applications to support various functions across teams
Promote engineering best practices
Independent and driven to react quickly to changing business strategy
Leverage your existing skills while learning and implementing new technologies
Identify additional areas of opportunity and means for knowledge sharing practices across teams


Team Requirements

Power Systems Modelling: Experience using power system modelling software such as PSCAD
Project Deployment: Experience with renewable energy deployment and construction a plus
Project Design: Experience with project design standard, site and product layouts, and CAD
Application Engineering: Solid Electrical engineering first principles, with experience with renewable energy storage systems technologies a plus
Project Engineering: Solid Electrical engineering first principles, with experience with renewable energy storage systems project/program management a plus
Service Engineering: Programming (Python, SQL) and solid electrical engineering first principles

Who We Are

Nuro is a robotics start-up whose mission is to accelerate the benefits of robotics for everyday life. We have an elite team of entrepreneurs and engineers, designers, and scientists. We believe AI and robotics are at the cusp of transforming daily life and we are dedicated to building meaningful products with this technology. Join us and play a critical role in our mission.

About The Role

Our robotics team is growing and we are looking for a software engineer to make our robots come to life. You will design and develop the critical code of Nuro's robots software that makes the robot sense and move in the world.

About The Work

Collaborate closely with hardware and software engineers during the definition, design, and verification phases

Work closely with Nuro's autonomy software team to integrate embedded systems into the self driving software stack




About You

You are a current BS, MS or PhD candidate in Computer Science, Robotics, or a related field

You have strong C/C++ programming skills

You possess solid computer science fundamentals, e.g. data structures, concurrency and algorithm design

You have strong problem solving ability

You are comfortable navigating in a fast-paced, startup environment



Nuro is an equal opportunity employer and expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status.

Who We Are

We believe AI and robotics are at the cusp of transforming daily life and we are dedicated to building meaningful products with this technology. Join us and play a critical role in our mission.

As a Robots hardware engineer intern, you will work closely with leading experts in the fields of mechanical engineering, test, electrical engineering, sensors and others. This role will give you the opportunity to work cross-functionally and collaborate with multiple teams.

Hardware Test: Manage designed parts and assemblies through validation testing and initial volume production

Sensors: Design mechanical assembly/parts for in-house sensors and integration for commodity sensors

Electrical Engineering: Bring-up and characterize our next generation of robotic delivery hardware

You have excellent communication skills

You have strong problem solving skills

You are comfortable thriving in a fast-paced, startup environment

description:

Job Overview

Qualcomm is a company of inventors that unlocked 5G ushering in an age of rapid acceleration in connectivity and new possibilities that will transform industries, create jobs, and enrich lives. But this is just the beginning. It takes inventive minds with diverse skills, backgrounds, and cultures to transform 5Gs potential into world-changing technologies and products. This is the Invention Age - and this is where you come in.

As a software engineer, you will work with a team of software engineers to develop, implement and maintain software for the most complex wireless devices. With a degree in computer science or engineering, you may analyze and identify system-level integration issues, plan and integrate new features, define integration and test platforms, develop and execute test scenarios for various multimedia applications such as audio, video, speech, imaging and graphics applications. You may also design and develop embedded, real-time systems along with wireless data protocols, applications engineering and technical support. Finally, you may also develop programs and user interfaces for BREW, our proprietary development language for mobile devices. SW engineers design and develop embedded, real-time systems along with wireless data protocols, applications engineering/technical support. Positions Include: - Linux OS Development - Real time OS Development - Wireless Connectivity, Communication & Network SW Protocol Development - Android Architecture - Device Driver Development - Multimedia Applications - Object Oriented and UI Design - Machine Learning - Windows Mobile Development

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field. 1+ years experience with Programming Language such as C, C++, Java, Python, etc. Master's Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field.

Preferred Qualifications

Graduated from a Top Tier Engineering University.

About AbbVie

AbbVie’s mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people’s lives across several key therapeutic areas: immunology, oncology, neuroscience, eye care, virology, women’s health and gastroenterology, in addition to products and services across its Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com . Follow @abbvie on Twitter , Facebook , Instagram , YouTube and LinkedIn .

AbbVie’s mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people’s lives across several key therapeutic areas: immunology, oncology, neuroscience, eye care, virology, women’s health and gastroenterology, in addition to products and services across its Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube and LinkedIn.

Envision spending your summer working with energetic colleagues and inspirational leaders all while gaining world class experience in one of the most dynamic organizations in the pharmaceutical industry. This is a reality for participants in the BTS Internship Program at AbbVie.

BTS Internship Program Description

As an AbbVie intern, you will participate in a paid, ten to twelve-week summer program that involves social and development activities, along with paid housing and shuttle services for eligible students. You will work on meaningful assignments that have a real impact on our business and patients worldwide, while also combining technical and business knowledge with analytical strength and creative problem solving.

AbbVie’s Worldwide Business Offers You An Opportunity For a Variety Of Potential Work Experiences That Are Aligned To a Variety Of Functional Areas, Including

Business Analytics
Project Management
Data Analytics
Data Science
Application Technology
Emerging Technology
Design & Architecture
Digital Technology
Information Security


As an intern you will be located at our corporate headquarters in north suburban Chicago. Throughout the summer there will be planned development and networking activities, along with paid housing and shuttle services for eligible students.

Qualifications

Basic Requirements

Pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in related discipline:
Management Information Systems, Information Technology, Data Science, Business Analytics or Computer Science with substantial information systems coursework
Engineering majors with a strong emphasis in a technical related curriculum
Strong academic performance, minimum cumulative GPA = 3.0/4.0
Completed at least two years of college education before beginning internship
Must be enrolled in school the semester following your internship
Must be authorized to work in the US on a permanent basis without requiring sponsorship
School and/or work experience using Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint
Preferred Requirements

Ideal candidates will combine technical and business knowledge with analytical strength and creative problem-solving abilities
Previous internship or related experience preferred
Proven track record of teamwork, adaptability, innovation, initiative and integrity
Excellent communication, leadership, and project management skills
AbbVie strongly considers high performing interns as candidates for their Business Technology Solutions Development Program (BTSDP) after they graduate. AbbVie’s BTSDP is a two-year rotational program with three separate work assignments. The rotations are carried out in a variety of areas that include managing projects, technical development, systems analysis, and business process review. The goal of the program is to identify and develop AbbVie’s future BTS leaders. If you are interested and want more information visit www.abbviecareers.com and look under student opportunities.
Recruitment Process
AbbVie participates in a variety of on-campus events such as: information sessions, career fairs and on-campus interviews. Are you interested in joining us as a candidate for one of these events? Please check the career services schedules at your school for the recruiting event schedule. AbbVie also posts our BTS Internships and Development Programs on our career website, if your school isn’t listed, please visit www.careers.abbvie.com.
Recruitment Timeline

Recruiting begins in August and will continue until all positions are filled, typically in the early Spring timeframe.
We strongly consider AbbVie Interns as candidates for full-time Development Program opportunities.
If there is interest in your application a member of our University Relations team will contact you to discuss next steps.

Position Description

You're about to take the next big step. You'll be at the intersection of technology and healthcare, about to create the next incredible solution. If you want to accelerate your learning in a technology environment that's always pushing the envelope, you've come to the right place. The technology group at Optum, part of UnitedHealth Group's thriving family of businesses, is a team of 22,000 people who are passionate about making a difference by using technology to help improve the lives of millions and make health care work better for all.

Throughout your 10-12 week internship in the Technology Development Program (TDP) , you'll be placed within one or more of our technology functions engaging in critical work in a variety of domains including software engineering, product engineering, platform engineering, enterprise architecture, data, and cybersecurity .You'll be leveraging modern technologies to transform and improve health care with a focus on simplification, enablement, enhancement, and modernization. In addition to challenge projects, TDP internships also offer networking, training and collaboration opportunities as well and mentorship from experienced technology professionals and leaders.

The intent of our internship program is to provide return internship opportunities or full-time employment opportunities at Optum, depending on eligibility. The Technology Development Program also offers a one-year rotational program for recent graduates.

As exciting as it may be, this kind of opportunity also presents unique challenges. You'll need to keep up with evolving technology, embrace our commitment to an agile culture that drives our solutions, and work in a disciplined approach to technology and processes that helps us protect the health care data of millions of individuals.

Key Information Regarding The Internship Program

This full-time intern position will be available for the summer,starting early June 2021.
Housing assistance may be available.
Sponsorship is not available for this position.

You'll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for potential future roles.

Required Qualifications

Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Masters degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, MIS, or other technology related fields, or a specialized certificate in a technology related field.
Must be actively enrolled in an accredited college/university or certificate program during the duration of the internship. Internships are not intended for graduating seniors.
Must be eligible to work in the U.S. without company sponsorship, now or in the future, for employment-based work authorization. F-1 visa holders with Curricular Practical Training (CPT) or Optional Practical Training (OPT) who will require visa sponsorship, TN visa holders, current H-1B visa holders, and/or those requiring green card sponsorship will not be considered.


Preferred Qualifications

Proficient in core programming concepts and at least one programming language (Example: Python, Java, C, SQL, .NET)
Minimum3.0 Cumulative GPA

Basking Ridge, NJ
Boston, MA
Eden Prairie, MN
Hartford, CT
Phoenix, AZ
Pittsburgh, PA
Plano, TX
Raleigh, NC
Schaumburg, IL

position: Cyber Security Software Development Engineer Co-Op, Advanced Cyber Science - Fall 2020
description:
Job Description

Do you have a passion for innovation?

So do we! At CACI our people are our greatest asset – we make sure your voice is heard and give you the resources to invent solutions to some of the most difficult challenges facing our customers. Our entrepreneurial environment fosters your best ideas and allows you to build your career to fit your creativity. Sound interesting? We’re always looking for the best and brightest to join our ranks and share the fun.

What We Are Looking For

We are seeking talented, creative and highly motivated undergraduate (Juniors & Seniors) and/or Graduate students for Co-Op/Internship and rising Computer Science and Computer/Electrical Engineers to work at our research and technology Labs in one of the following locations: Florham Park, NJ . We are seeking the ‘Best and Brightest’ with a "PASSION" to solve tough challenges through innovation and the application of Science and Technology.

What You’ll Get To Do

The Cyber Department performs basic and Applied Research and Prototype Development in various aspects of Cyber and general Network Security. The ideal candidate for this role will perform research, prototype development, software engineering and integrated systems development in various aspects of cyber, analytics, machine learning, optimization, computer networking and general network security.

You’ll Bring These Qualifications

Upper Classman leading to BS, or graduate studies leading to MS or Ph. D. in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering
Research solutions to challenging Cyber, analytics, Machine Learning, optimization and computer networking problems
Design, implement and test research prototype software
Integrate software into larger system, design test cases and evaluate solution effectiveness
Contribute to high performance technical teams to innovate and execute both short-term and long-term project goals
Contribute to briefing project results and demo software and/or hardware to technical and non-technical audiences
Travel to other CACI/LGS Locations or Customer Sites as necessary
Understand and adhere to all CACI/LGS Ethical and Compliance policies
Proactively ensure a safe work environment and adhere to CACI/LGS EH&S policies and procedures
Ability to obtain/maintain government security clearance at the level required to perform the duties of the position
Willingness to learn new skills and eagerness to investigate new problems both independently and as part of a small team
Broad computer science, analytics, machine learning, optimization and/or networking background, which may include knowledge in cybersecurity, IP networking, and software development
Strong analytical skills with the ability to independently solve problems
Software development and software engineering life cycle experience in current languages and best practices
Working knowledge of IP (v4 and v6) and computer and network security
Perform other duties as required
Ability to clearly communicate technical ideas


These Qualifications Would Be Nice To Have

Network security, especially security of the public Internet
Security strengths and weaknesses of protocols at the network, transport, and application layers
Intrusion detection systems, information security systems, firewalls, antivirus systems, and honeypots
Fingerprinting, scanning, and hacking techniques
Machine learning and data analytics
Optimization, cryptography and other advanced algorithms
Experience with distributed computing and mobile ad hoc networking protocols and implementations


Working Conditions

Work is typically performed in an office environment which requires proper safety precautions
Work requires some physical effort in the handling of materials, boxes, or equipment
The above job description is not intended to be, nor should it be construed as, exhaustive of all responsibilities, skills, efforts, or working conditions associated with the job
Requests for reasonable accommodations will be considered to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this position


What We Can Offer You

We’ve been named a Best Place to Work by the Washington Post
Our employees value the flexibility at CACI that allows them to balance quality work and their personal lives
We offer competitive benefits and learning and development opportunities
We are mission-oriented and ever vigilant in aligning our solutions with the nation’s highest priorities
For over 55 years, the principles of CACI’s unique, character-based culture have been the driving force behind our success
LGS Innovations and its subsidiaries are wholly-owned subsidiaries of CACI International, Inc.


LGSACS

inrn2

Job Location

US-Florham Park-NJ-NEW JERSEY METRO

CACI employs a diverse range of talent to create an environment that fuels innovation and fosters continuous improvement and success. At CACI, you will have the opportunity to make an immediate impact by providing information solutions and services in support of national security missions and government transformation for Intelligence, Defense, and Federal Civilian customers. CACI is proud to provide dynamic careers for employees worldwide. CACI is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Females/Minorities/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.

position: SSD Data Center Technical Engineer Intern
description:
Job ID:JR0135182

Job Category:Intern/Student

Primary Location:Folsom, CA US

Other Locations:

Job Type:Intern

SSD Data Center Technical Engineer Intern Job Description

The SSD Data Center Technical Performance Internship role offers hands-on and direct experience in cutting edge storage technology solutions. Specifically, the internship is an opportunity to learn about fast-growing solid state drive performance and how it is changing the data center and enterprise based computing environments.

The intern will work primarily with the technical product marketing engineering teams to support competitive benchmarking, performance validation, system configuration, technical data collection and testing. The role will involve setting up hardware and defining test procedures and setting up software and defining test procedures. Additionally, the intern will drive performance benchmarking and will work with other teams to support creation of marketing documentation to drive SSD product demand.

This is a dynamic fulltime internship role that will allow the candidate to grow their skills in multiple areas. The duration of the internship is targeted for a 6-12 months internship. Work spans from technical marketing activities, engineering debug, and business development. Possible domestic travel. Some repetitive work is required and expected.

Responsibilities may be quite diverse of a technical nature. U.S. experience and education requirements will vary significantly depending on the unique needs of the job. Job assignments are usually for the summer or for short periods during breaks from school.

Responsibilities May Include, But Are Not Limited To

Applicants will creatively apply the technical know-how (engineering fundamentals, scientific knowledge, systems thinking, analytical thinking, prototyping, and testing knowledge) against design constraints and boundary conditions (industrial design, cost, performance criteria and other design constraints) to research, develop and productive mass producible solutions.


The Ideal Candidate Should Exhibit The Following Behavioral Traits

Self-motivated individual willing to take and follow directions and deliver to schedule Communication and interpersonal skills
Quantitative, analytical, and problem solving skills, problem/conflict resolution skills
Effective prioritization and time management skills
Communications skills as internal/external customer interaction


Qualifications

You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Experience listed below would be obtained through a combination of your school work/classes/research and/or relevant previous job and/or internship experiences.

Minimum Qualifications

The candidate must be pursuing a MS degree in Electrical Engineering, Software Engineering, Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related field.

Minimum 3+ months of experience in/with the following:

Excel, Power Point
Command Line
Linux OS/Vmware
Scripting Language like Python, C/C++, VB, others


Preferred Qualifications

Experience with debugging, tuning, bench-marking.
Experience with scripting for repeatable testing.
Storage SSDs/NVMe, RAM experience


Inside this Business Group

Non-Volatile Solutions Memory Group: The Non-Volatile Memory Solutions Group is a worldwide organization that delivers NAND flash memory products for use in Solid State Drives (SSDs), portable memory storage devices, digital camera memory cards, and other devices. The group is responsible for NVM technology design and development, complete Solid State Drive (SSD) system hardware and firmware development, as well as wafer and SSD manufacturing.

Posting Statement

Product Development & Management Co-Ops at Cox are considered to be an integral part of the staff. They are provided with projects that are both technically challenging and educationally stimulating and work under the guidance of the senior staff.

For Fall 2020, we have an opportunity in our team for enthusiastic individuals with an interest in both the technology and business side of the telecommunications industry who are willing to help us develop and maintain the next generation of business Internet products.

Projects/Assignments may include but are not limited to the following:


Assisting with research and competitive analysis on the products, applications and devices offered by Cox, other cable companies, and our competitors.
Assisting with ideation, concept development, and detailed requirements writing for Internet functionality.
Assisting with the product development and management processes through the entire lifecycle of various Internet projects from initial ideation through post-launch optimization and customer support.
Assisting with project financial tracking and the preparation/updating of business and usage models.
Assisting in the compilation and analysis of data for presentation to upper management.
Ability to work closely and collaboratively with boundary partners and drive results
General office work, as required.

Strong desire to learn about both the technological and business sides of developing and managing new products
Self-motivation and accountability
Excellent verbal, written, and presentation skills


Minimum Requirements

Qualifications:


Currently enrolled in a technical or business degree program such as Engineering, Technology, Networking, Management, Business, or Information Sciences program with a strong academical record.
Students must be able to commit to a minimum of three Co-op semester rotations (typically Freshmen, Sophomores, and/or Juniors).
