description:
Why This Role is Important to Us

CCA Coop team will be a part of the CCA IT team to deliver projects in a fast-paced manner in Enterprise Data Management, and Enterprise Application Integration. The software engineering coop program is aimed at accelerating the delivery of software delivery lifecycle in the following areas that are critical to technology modernization and digital transformation impacting our members and providers.

What You'll Be Doing

The Co-Op is expected to play a role in one or more of the below mentioned activities.

Web and Mobile application development
Open API Gateway development
Robotic Process Automation
Data Design, Modelling, and Access
Enterprise architecture
Project Planning and Project Management
Documentation

Our goal is to move projects quickly from concept to pilot, and pilot to production, to realize the value of our investments. The Software Engineering Co-Op program is a specialized program for those that are looking for hands-on experience in engineering software solutions. It is for those students that are eager to actively participate through the design, development, testing, and implementation of software solutions. Projects will be selected to represent key problems worth solving which have direct applicability to improving business results and experience of members and providers.

Attitude: Can-Do and Positive attitude and drive to self-learn and solve complex problems.

What We're Looking For

– Currently registered as a senior student in a Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Data Management or a related program

– Some experience with developing applications for in school or extra-curricular projects

– Comfortable with at least one scripting language, such as Python or JavaScript

– Comfortable with C#, Java, .Net, or other object-oriented development environment

– A collaborative team player with strong ideas and good listening skills

– Ability to work in the United States.

Experience: Undergraduate Juniors up to Masters' studentsEducation: Currently Pursuing Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Highly-Rigorous Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or other highly-technical field of studyPosition Type: 10+ WeeksOpportunity:PDT Partners - a proprietary quantitative investment manager - is seeking talented engineering students for Software Engineering focused internships. Our custom-designed program enables students to contribute to our technology-critical, algorithmic trading business while honing their technical skills.Students will work closely with highly-accessible and supportive senior developers for every project. Mentors are deeply-technical and hands-on developers who provide guidance during the project, and are available for design-sessions, discussions and learning throughout the co-op.The program's social events - PDT summer picnic, movie nights, ice cream social, bowling night, Yankees/Mets games, board game nights, and plenty of food-centric activities - provide excellent opportunities to get to know our team.PDT is a fun and collaborative community of passionate engineers, science fiction fans, musicians, martial artists, extreme-sports enthusiasts, and foodies who enjoy a non-hierarchical, professional environment.Our culture encourages and expects significant contribution from all members. PDT also offers full-time programming and systems engineering opportunities for graduating seniors and masters' students in computer science and engineering.Projects:Most of our software is developed in-house for our algorithmic trading business: off-the-shelf solutions simply don't scale to our needs. You will work closely with expert developers on technically-challenging projects to design, develop, debug, and test our software components for large handling of financial data, for real-time events and batch processing.Depending on the specific project, you may:* Gain exposure to various development environments: Solaris, Linux, Windows operating systems* Work on projects that require client and server-side implementation* Face problems that don't have well-defined solutions - creativity is essential to come up with the best possible answers, including ones that explore new technologies like web development in Flex* Learn about the financial markets, risk metrics, and portfolio management* Navigate various trading technologies like FIX messaging and order management systems* Construct and maintain precise, large-scale data sets on various database platforms* Develop code libraries that are used in research infrastructureYou will also learn to correctly apply new idioms, techniques and algorithms in the following areas:* Program correctness (resource management, exception safety, reentrancy/thread safety)* Maintainability (portability, good coding practices, adherence to coding standards, unit testing, documentation)* Efficiency (optimal data structures/algorithms, understanding of high-/low- level implications and trade-offs in design choices, parallelization)Requirements:Ideal candidates have the following knowledge and/or wish to learn more about:* Knowledge of an OO language such as: C++, C#, Java* Scripting in Python* Knowledge of databases - SQL, Cassandra, PostgreSQL* Experience working with UnixAdditional skills & attributes required:* Interest in working in a world-class, professional environment* Smart, fast-learner, intellectually curious, problem-solving approach* Can-do attitude, with sense of urgency* Strong verbal and written communication skills* Committed to improvement and keen to apply constructive feedback* Excellent academic background from a rigorous and challenging computer science program

position: 2020 – 2021 Yearlong Scheduling and Service Planning Intern
description:
Description

 You might be thinking, "What opportunities does CTA have for students with my degree and credentials?"




You may be surprised to learn that we hire interns with a diverse skill set and a multitude of majors. In fact, we hire students in good academic standing with a variety of degrees that you may not have expected, and we want to consider you for available opportunities!

Interns at CTA work in a range of departments including:

Administration Departments ranging from Diversity/EEO, Human Resources, Training and Workforce Development and more
Board and President’s Office
Communications
Finance and Purchasing
Infrastructure
Law
Legislative Affairs and Government and Community Relations
Safety and Security
Technology
Transit Operations




Our internships are project-based; therefore, the skills that we seek vary based on the needs of the projects during each term. All majors are welcome to apply, but please see education experience/requirements for specifics about what disciplines each internship project is seeking.

Internships are part-time (15 hours a week) during the school year and full-time (40 hours a week) during the summer.




In this role within the Scheduling and Service Planning unit, interns will:

Develop a metric system to improve the Scheduling Department’s running time analysis workflow.
Write a program to measure the effectiveness of running time analysis.
Create an online platform for displaying the metric system.




 

Qualifications

Educational Experience/Requirements:

Minimum Level of Education: Undergraduate Junior

Preferred Major(s): Computer Science, Industrial Engineering, Operations Research, Urban Planning or a closely related field

Physical Requirements:

The demands associated with the normal office environment

Light physical activity, including walking outdoors and climbing stairs

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Strong Microsoft Office and computer skills

Good oral and written communication skills

Good analytical and critical thinking skills

Good organizational skills with attention to detail

Good project management skills

Ability to read and comprehend SQL statements

Experience with Python, HTML, JavaScript, Oracle

Experience with ArcGIS and Hastus (preferred)

Knowledge of general transit fundamentals (scheduling and operations desired)

Bright Power is the premier provider of energy and water management services for real estate owners, investors, and operators. We offer integrated solutions that deliver value to your bottom line, occupants, and the environment. From utility bill analytics down to the nuts and bolts of making physical improvements to buildings, Bright Power does it all.

The Bright Power Energy Audit Team is comprised of a diverse, talented, and hard-working group of individuals committed to growing this industry and to making a positive impact on the environment. We focus on finding real solutions for Existing Buildings and providing a path the actualize building performance optimization.

JOIN US

Bright Power has been a transformative player in clean energy and sustainable housing for 15 years. Our Clients include a vast network of owners, developers, Fortune 1000 financial and real estate investors, privately held firms, and some of the nation’s largest property managers. We are passionate about improving the larger environment through our work making buildings more efficient.

The Energy Audit Team works with Bright Power clients to help clients understand their buildings’ energy usage, assess current performance, troubleshoot problems, and make recommendations to reduce building energy and water consumption as well as improve occupant health and safety. Our goal is to work with existing buildings decision makers to enact real change and develop retrofit project for our Existing Buildings Retrofit Team to design and implement.

Title: Energy Audit Intern

Location: New York, NY

Bright Power, Inc. is seeking an enthusiastic and hard-working Energy Audit Intern to work on challenging energy and water efficiency projects in multifamily buildings. The candidate should be very self-motivated, enjoy working with and designing systems, adapt quickly to new technologies, and get a kick out of finding energy and water savings opportunities in the world around them. The candidate should be someone eager and hungry to learn as we guide them through our training program. The candidate will be part of our headquarters in New York City, and will join our team of engineers, auditors, analysts, software developers, data scientists, account managers, and marketers.

The Role

Process energy efficiency incentives and assist in Local Law administration including NYC Local Law 87 and Local Law 97 compliance
Assist Energy Auditors in performing ASHRAE Level 1, 2 & 3 energy audits, retro-commissioning, and feasibility studies by collecting site data and assisting with testing building systems
Assist Energy Auditors in conducting site assessments and testing.
Assist Energy Auditors in evaluating the economic, engineering, or pragmatic feasibility of energy and water efficiency improvement projects.
Assist Energy Auditors in conducting cost-benefit analyses, determines the potential return on investments, evaluate plans or system layouts, designs objectives, aligns resources, determines project scope and ensures compliance with Federal, State, or local laws.
Assist Energy Auditors in energy modeling and cost estimating.
Analyze building utility bills to determine practical energy usage and trends.
Assist Energy Auditors in preparing reports and technical documents and present findings to property managers, building owners, co-op/condominium boards, and other decision makers at client buildings.


Qualifications

Positive attitude and eagerness to learn
Basic understanding of building science, building systems, controls, and new technologies.
Knowledge of lifecycle analysis of facility efficiency and energy conservation projects.
Ability to inspect or monitor energy systems, including heating, ventilation, and air conditioning (HVAC) systems to determine energy use or potential energy savings.
Understanding of architectural & MEP plans and specifications.
Ability to work hands-on, in buildings to conduct testing of building systems
High proficiency in Excel and excellent computer skills.
Creative problem-solving ability.
Ability to communicate orally and in writing with key stakeholders, including property management companies and building management staff, in order to exchange information, explain the project, ensure understanding of programs, and to coordinate compliance efforts.


Education/Experience

Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Engineering, Building Science, Construction, Energy Analysis, Environmental Studies, or a relevant field from an accredited four year college or university.
Experience conducting energy audits
Applicable licenses and certifications preferred: EIT, CEM, EMIT, MFBA, BEAP.

Ideal candidate would have one or more of the following:

Energy auditing experience.
Experience with multifamily and light commercial building types and associated systems.
Experience working within government and utility incentive programs.
Experience with Local Law 87 and performing retro-commissioning.
Energy modeling experience.
Construction management experience.
Active participation in professional industry associations.
Excellent communication skills.
Experience implementing energy and/or water efficiency projects.

WELL is a patient communication infrastructure for healthcare. We enable enterprise health systems, private practices, and vendors to conduct seamless conversations with patients across multiple channels — including texting, email, telephone, and live chat.

With WELL, patients receive all of their healthcare communication from one trusted source — their provider. The platform empowers service representatives to converse with patients in real time, ensuring patients feel heard while driving staff efficiency and increased revenue.

Founded in 2015, WELL is based in Santa Barbara, California and is the highest rated patient engagement software on G2. WELL serves many of the country's leading health systems and more than 20 million patients.

WELL is proud to have been named one of the 2020 Central Coast Best Places to Work by the Pacific Coast Business Times and one of the 2020 Best Places to Work in Healthcare by Modern Healthcare. To learn more about WELL, please visit our LinkedIn.

Summary

WELL's DevOps team is seeking an intern. This internship will last for a period of 8-12 weeks and will be fully remote. This intern will work 40 hours per week. This internship is paid.

You will be working with the DevOps team to conduct basic server maintenance, install software, perform some development on key DevOps tools for automation within a cloud infrastructure.

This is an exciting opportunity for someone that wants to learn more about DevOps and work at a fast-paced startup. You will join a talented team who is highly engaged with a lot of work across a wide range of DevOps tools and infrastructure.

Conducting basic server operating tasks including patching and general configuration changes

Responsibilities

Possesses high level of understanding of business areas and/or functions necessary to successfully undertake technical analysis, design, construction and implementation of system improvements.

Reviews, documents, and recommends technology changes to support or improve existing processes.
Translate identified business requirements for complex business changes into a process design for use by Adtalem Global Education Information Technology teams and/or third-party vendors.

Research reported issues within the student finance systems and processes, and translates into enhancements as needed.

Creates systems and process documentation for all processes for purpose of training and business continuity.
Responsive to end-user community and IT with issue analysis and resolution. Provides proactive updates until issues are resolved.
Completes other projects and duties as assigned.
Completes other duties as assigned.


Qualifications

Bachelor’s in Computer Science, Education or Business required, Master’s preferred.
Minimum 3 years in student finance role, preferably with strong use of computer applications and a good understanding of the end to end student finance life cycle.
Minimum of 3 years in a specific functional business related field.
Experience working with Higher Education ERP systems, including Student Finance systems. Experience with ProSAM, Banner and TouchNet systems a plus.
Technical skills in understanding SQL queries
Technical skills in understanding Unix/Linux commands -
Proficient with understanding and analyzing business needs, designing solutions based on needs, and articulating business impacts.
Experience with systems development lifecycle and system management processes, including business requirements, design, and configuration, and user acceptance testing.
Detailed and process oriented with demonstrated capabilities in business process design, modeling and requirements analysis; ability to translate into detailed system requirements specifications.
Working knowledge of MS Word and MS Excel required.
Familiarity with Business Process Management (BPM) methodology (is a plus) and desire experience working with tools/technologies required to facilitate process modeling and documentation.
Experience working in multiple Information Technology environments preferred.
Advanced written and oral communication skills.
Ability to train other colleagues on new regulations and processes.
Excellent collaboration, facilitation and interpersonal skills.

position: Network Support Engineer Intern - Winter 2021 Internship (Meraki)
description:
Winter Internship (January - April 2021, full-time)

Cisco Meraki Business Unit

At Cisco Meraki, our Network Support Engineer Interns act as key players on the Support team! You will troubleshoot cases that cover the entire Meraki product line, including our wireless access points, security appliances, switches, and Systems Manager application, just like our full-time engineers. With a steep learning curve and a fun, challenging work environment, our interns come out of the program with a deeper understanding of networking, stronger problem-solving skills, and a mastery of customer support that will carry with them for the rest of their careers. Our interns are an integral part of the Support team - we look for smart, passionate individuals who are open to taking on any task and are proactive in helping the team. The position is full-time and located in San Francisco.

Perks? We offer paid internships along with free, furnished housing or housing stipend for the duration of your stay in San Francisco. Sound like a fit? Great, we'd love to talk to you!

Responsibilities

Research and resolve issues reported by Meraki customers and partners
Identify issues suitable for entry in the Meraki Knowledge Base
Write, review, and release KB articles
Assist with lab testing work as needed for Meraki products
Identify, reproduce, and document bugs
Have a project in mind? Let us know and we'll help to make it happen!



Qualifications

Must be a Junior or Senior working towards a B.S in Networking and Systems Administration, Computer Information Technology, Network Technologies, Computer Science, or a related discipline from an accredited university - Not accepting Masters students
Basic understanding of networking fundamentals, e.g. be able to explain the functions of and differences among the link, network, transport, and application layers
A passion to assist and problem-solve with our customers
Outstanding account management, follow-through, and problem-solving skills
Resourcefulness and attention to detail
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal



Cisco is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis. Job Summary

Here at ON Semiconductor we take great pride in our internship program and the efforts we take to provide students with hands-on industry experience. We provide competitive pay, medical benefits, various networking event opportunities, and flexible hours based on school schedule.

This internship is with the “External Quality Service Provider” organization; working on an ON Semiconductor global project to drive and improve quality across all External ON Semiconductor service provider sites. The job will introduce the student to all aspects of business in a large corporation with focus on the external service provider quality standards: ISO 9001 (quality), IATF / VDA6.3 (automotive), MIL-PRF 38535 (USA military), AS9100 (aerospace) and ISO 17025 (laboratories).

With this position the student will have the opportunity to

Develop a clear project plan to move the “external service provider” excel spread sheet into a web-site or already established ON Semiconductor system (i.e. Oracle, Agile…etc).
System must have all required input for each type of external service provider; Calibration labs, Reliability labs, Product Analysis Labs and Design Services.
System will electronically send out and receive approvals, disapproval and/or other input as needed.
Historical records and results will be available.
Based on input, the system will calculate RISK for each service provider.
System will define (based on RISK calculations) external sites that require audit each year (highest RISK).
System will pull data to create graphs showing snap shots in time and long term RISK reduction.
Work with and learn the quality standards: AS9100D, IATF 16949, VDA6.3, ISO 9001, MIL-PRF 38535 and ISO 17025.
Assist as needed on training and update of training for global and site process owners at all ON Semiconductor sites to assist with roll out and implementation of “new quality standards” for selection, use and maintenance of external service providers. Provide recorded sessions of training using the ON Semiconductor SABA training system.
Assist – as needed - with proper solving of issues and implementation of corrective actions at external service provider sites.


Performance Objectives

This opportunity will ask a student to have the following performance objectives:


Computer Science programming skills, including knowledge to manipulate and/or create a data-base.
Competent in Micro-soft office tools.
Good communication skills.
Business Savvy.
The following knowledge or skills would be helpful but not required:
Semiconductor manufacturing and/or design.
Program management.
Share Point software.
ISO 9001 or other quality standards.
APQP Semiconductor product/process development process.


Qualifications

In order to be considered for an internship, you must be a student currently enrolled in school pursuing an accredited degree program. This position is specifically looking for an undergraduate seeking a BS or BA in Computer Science or Engineering. Or, a Graduate seeking a Master's Degree.

ON Semiconductor (Nasdaq: ON) is driving energy efficient innovations, empowering customers to reduce global energy use. The company is a leading supplier of semiconductor-based solutions, offering a comprehensive portfolio of energy efficient power and signal management, logic, standard and custom devices. The company's products help engineers solve their unique design challenges in automotive, communications, computing, consumer, industrial, medical and military/aerospace applications. ON Semiconductor operates a responsive, reliable, world-class supply chain and quality program, and a network of manufacturing facilities, sales offices and design centers in key markets throughout North America, Europe and the Asia Pacific regions.

position: Surround View Camera System Feature Owner
description:
Candidate must be fully authorized to work in the US. Visa transfer/sponsorship not available for this role.

Location: Dearborn, Michigan

A unique perspective can change everything

You are ambitious and have worked hard to get where you are. You are looking ahead to the next opportunity; perhaps a new challenge that will stretch your skills, broaden your experience, and deliver rewards. You have come to the right place. What impact will you make?

Envorso Overview

Team members of ENVORSO, LLC and its subsidiaries have provided industry-leading decision support, consulting, portfolio management and advisory services to many of the world's most admired brands, including many of the Fortune 500 and a significant number of private and middle market companies.

We are responsible for features today that use the sensors, which will bring autonomy tomorrow. We are a dynamic group of engineers striving to find new ways to further technology in the context of making drivers’ lives easier and safer. We are responsible for both existing and future technologies in the driver assistance area, using cameras, radar, and ultrasonic sensors, as well as powerful ECUs with advanced processing capability and machine vision, to deliver new features for our customers. We are delivering systems that assist our customers in their commutes every day, while acting as a stepping-stone towards full autonomy.

Position Responsibilities

Lead with tier 1 supplier the feature design, development and model development of new camera based driver assistance features
Lead with tier 1 the development of Feature specifications, FMEAs, robustness disciplines and Design Verification Plans for advanced camera features
Lead feature development. Own feature interfaces and develop interface requirements through all affected parties (Vehicle engineering, core and D&R engineering) of affected subsystems/components. Own feature description and communicate to vehicle teams /feature planning and marketing.
Support HMI strategy development with HMI and Ergonomics
Support the HMI strategy implementation into components (Switches/Instrument cluster displays, Center Stack displays, haptic feedbacks, other indicators) and support the approval process through appropriate governing bodies
Understand the performance requirements for the cameras (both as a visual image and as a sensor), and establish procedures to verify performance both quantitatively and subjectively
Understand system interactions in terms of vehicle dynamics to identify possible improvements and trade-offs. Identify changes needed to improve performance and meet objectives
Establish Feature objectives and ensure system operation to meet the objectives through structured component, sub-system, and system level test methodologies


Required Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or related degree
1+ year of experience with camera based driver assistance systems (Coursework/Internship/Co-op experience Allowed)
1+ year of experience with Control algorithm development (Coursework/Internship/Co-op experience Allowed)
1+ year of experience using Matlab, Simulink, dSpace and/or Vector CAN tools (Coursework/Internship/Co-op experience Allowed)


Preferred Qualifications

1+ year of writing vehicle, system, feature or component specifications
1+ year of writing Design Verification Methods for driver assistance features
Familiarity with driver assistance algorithms like Object Detection and path planning,
Experience developing and conducting laboratory and vehicle tests
Experience with data collection and analysis of camera systems
Experience with design and development of image processing or similar digital signal processing applications
Familiarity with functional safety and ISO 26262
Familiarity with FMVSS 111
Experience with structured problem solving methodologies (8Ds, 6-Sigma, Shainin,..)
Program Management and/or Design and Release experience in automotive electronic module development


ENVORSO Benefits

We believe that we're only as good as our people, and our clients trust that Envorso is here to make a positive impact in the world. We intentionally take great care of our people, so our people take great care of our clients!

Our Current Benefits Program Includes

ENVORSO's Total Commit Program reflects our continued commitment to lead off the front, in everything we do. We take pride in offering a comprehensive variety of programs and resources to support your health and well-being needs.

Paid Time Off & Holidays

PTO gives professionals the flexibility to manage time off in a way that works best for them. ENVORSO’S PTO program gives professionals an allotment of days that encompass vacation, personal, and sick time. On average, PTO and holidays total a minimum of 30 days off per year! Actual PTO accrual depends on the individual’s position and years of eligible service.

Medical, Dental and Vision

ENVORSO's healthcare offerings include competitive medical, dental, and vision plans. 100% Employer Paid Monthly Healthcare Premiums!

Medical and Dental: Blue Cross Blue Shield

Vision: VSP Vision Care

Life Insurance & Disability

Life Insurance includes core coverage for our professionals
Optional life and accident coverage can be purchased for professionals and/or their eligible dependents

Retirement

401K program


NO THIRD PARTIES

description:

A unique perspective can change everything

You are ambitious and have worked hard to get where you are. You are looking ahead to the next opportunity; perhaps a new challenge that will stretch your skills, broaden your experience, and deliver rewards. You have come to the right place. What impact will you make?

Envorso Overview

Team members of ENVORSO, LLC and its subsidiaries have provided industry-leading decision support, consulting, portfolio management and advisory services to many of the world's most admired brands, including many of the Fortune 500 and a significant number of private and middle market companies.

We are seeking professionals who can contribute to our efforts with experience in the development of sensors, ECUs, models and software. This software test position is passionate about the validation and verification of new features per the DAT roadmap, but could also involve other elements of the process as we seek to add high quality people to the team.

Position Responsibilities

Lead and conduct the verification and validation of ADAS related software
Develop test procedures, plans, automated scripts, and cases
Define the test setup required to support validation and verification activities. For example, identify the equipment, tools, licenses, hardware, test systems (i.e. HiL), etc... needed and support test bench bring up
Identify test dependencies such as specifications, interfaces, compliance, hardware, software components, etc...
Determine opportunities and provide support for automation and tooling
Perform automated and manual test execution, results analysis, root cause analysis, and verifications
Contribute to team results through ownership in agile scrum development sprints
Collaborate cross-functionally with technical specialists, feature owners, development teams, and other test teams in support of testing and development activities


Required Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or Computer Science
1+ year of experience with embedded hardware and/or software design (including coursework/internship/co-op experience)


Preferred Qualifications

3+ years of experience as an automation developer or test engineer
Understanding of Feature specifications, FMEAs, robustness disciplines and Design Verification Plan
Understanding of performance requirements and the interactions with other features and the system, and establish procedures to verify performance both quantitatively and subjectively
Familiarity with control algorithms using Matlab, Simulink or equivalent

Writing and maintaining code that supports the investment research production processes
Proposing and implementing performance improvements in our data analysis processes
Researching predictable patterns in data relevant to financial markets

Knowledge of OOP paradigms, data structures, and numerical algorithms
Understanding of probability, statistics, linear regression, and time-series analysis
Curiosity and a willingness to learn new technologies
Interest in financial markets
Excellent communication skills including data visualization

Job Description:

Software Engineering Intern – Baltimore/Rockville, MD

The Leidos Health group is seeking the best and brightest minds, with a passion for technology, to join our Intern Program. As a technology intern at Leidos, you will be immersed in a rich technical experience where you will work side-by-side with senior leaders, architects, developers, fellow interns, and others. In addition to hands-on experience, the program will also provide career development opportunities that include a summer series of events and various networking engagements across the organization.

Primary Responsibilities

As a software engineer intern you will work on developing/testing software for our federal health clients. This work will include supporting various types of development testing such as GUI, Data/ETL, workflows, accessibility, as well as test automation. The project will require learning and using skills in JAVA, Selenium, SQL, Oracle and/or related technologies, as well as learning about the internal software life cycle processes and tools used in the program. The Systems for Inspections, Recalls, Compliance Enforcement (SIRCE) and Imports program supports the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) Office of Regulatory Affairs’ (ORA) critical work to safeguard the foods, drugs, devices, biologics, and veterinary products that the Agency regulates. These systems continue to evolve to meet emerging business needs and to support new mandates and initiatives. It is important to analyze and implement advances in technologies that will improve efficiency and performance leading to greater user satisfaction and reducing the cost of operations and maintenance (O&M). Effort is underway to develop state of the art applications that can be used on various platforms and to retire some of the legacy systems with modern and efficient applications.

Basic Qualifications

Must be US Citizen or Green Card Holder with the ability to obtain a Public Trust security clearance
Must be enrolled in an accredited college/university pursuing a BS degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or Electrical Engineering, or similar
Good analytical skills
Good written and verbal communication skills


Preferred Qualifications

Experience with software development/testing
Experience with test automation

Pay And Benefits

Pay and benefits are fundamental to any career decision. That's why we craft compensation packages that reflect the importance of the work we do for our customers. Leidos will never ask you to provide payment-related information at any part of the employment application process. If you receive an email purporting to be from Leidos that asks for payment-related information or any other personal information, please report the email to [email protected] .

Commitment to Diversity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, ethnicity, age, national origin, citizenship, religion, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, pregnancy, family structure, marital status, ancestry, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law. Leidos will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with relevant laws.

Position Description

We are seeking a motivated intern with strong technical skills and broad interests to join the Traer Lab and contribute to our research modeling human perception and mental representation of natural scenes. This position provides opportunities to learn about: the human mind (perception, cognition), natural scenes in which we live (scene-analysis, natural scene statistics), quantitative modeling (inference, physics, machine learning), and computational methods for open science (collaborative coding, database management, version control). Applicants need not have prior experience with all of these topics, but they must be willing to learn the basics of all.

Position duties include: development of shared lab toolboxes and style guides, code reviews, project documentation, management of lab computational resources, design and implementation of behavioral experiments, and data analysis. Interpersonal skills are necessary as the intern will work as part of a research team, which includes the PI, postdocs, students, and collaborators. In addition to maintaining technical resources for the lab, the intern is encouraged to present at conferences and co-author papers to develop their own research careers.

The initial appointment will be for one year beginning in Fall 2020, with the possibility of renewal for a 2nd year.

Education Requirement

Bachelor's degree in Psychology, Neuroscience, or any quantitative field (Physics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, etc.) and a plan to pursue graduate study.

Required Qualifications

Experience with (at least some of) the following computational tools: Python scientific computing packages, Unix shell scripting, large-scale computing, TensorFlow, database management, JavaScript, HTML/CSS.
Knowledge of standard coding best practices (version control, style-guides, and code reviews).
Experience working in a research laboratory.
Ability to work 40 hours per week, typically during the week but, when necessary, over the weekend and evenings.
Excellent organizational, interpersonal, and communication skills.
Capable of independent, self-directed work as well as working in a team environment.
US citizenship or permanent residency.


Desirable Qualifications

Experience performing behavioral experiments with humans.
Experience working with and calibrating technical laboratory equipment (microphones, speakers/headphones, cameras, displays, motion trackers, arduinos, 3D printers, etc.).

Here at UFG, we have a shared vision built on the dynamic foundation of people, service, profit and growth. We believe this vision is the right approach for our employees, and the smart approach for our business. If you believe in the principles of “people and service” and feel excitement from “profit and growth,” then we encourage you to check out our internship program.

UFG can offer you an award-winning workplace and a trustworthy, financially-stable company. While we’ve always known our commitment to employees and financial stewardship, it is good to have others recognize our dedicated efforts. UFG was named to the “2017 Top Workplaces” list by The Des Moines Register, and was also included on the Forbes’ America’s Most Trustworthy Financial Companies” list for 2015, 2016 and 2017. Additionally, UFG is a super-regional property and casualty insurer rated “A” (Excellent) by A.M. Best Company.

UFG is looking for an ambitious, career-minded individual with a strong data science aptitude and outstanding people skills for a professional Data Science Co-op/Internship. Get a head start with this internship as the hours during the semester are flexible/part-time while moving to full-time in the Summer.

These positions can be located at our office in Pennington, NJ or Webster, TX.

INDHP

Assist with the data science team with the following daily activities:


Work with management to prioritize modeling needs
Support research and development efforts in a diverse set of challenges as we rapidly prototype and build new models
Extensive experience analyzing data and a broad understanding of core statistical and ML techniques
Design, build, and deploy Machine Learning (ML) systems aligning to business objectives
Translate and champion ML capabilities for non-technical audiences
Stay current with modeling techniques/technologies
Maintain positive, professional business acumen and relationships with cross-functional teams and external customers
Train end users on new models
Research opportunities for data acquisition and new uses for existing data
Collaborate with data architects, analysts and IT team members on project goals
Bachelor’s degree required - preferably in related field of study such as actuarial science, or statistics/applied statistics
Competencies typically acquired through a Ph.D. (in Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, or other scientific field of study) preferred.
Applicants should possess proven technical and analytical abilities, leadership potential, innovation, creativity and superb communication skills.
Standard knowledge in the use of data sources and applications to conduct research
Strong working knowledge of data analysis
Ability to analyze data and review analysis from others and identify and resolve basic data issues
Computer proficiency in Microsoft Office products including Excel, Word, Outlook, PowerPoint
Strong written and verbal communication skills including the ability to effectively collaborate with multi-disciplinary groups and all organizational levels
High level organizational and project management skills in order to handle multiple concurrent assignments in a timely manner and to monitor processes throughout a team or department
Strong decision making skills
Works effectively in a team environment
Experience working with SQL, SAS, R languages preferred

Welcome to Planet. We believe in using space to help life on Earth. Planet designs, builds, and operates the largest constellation of imaging satellites in history. This constellation delivers an unprecedented dataset of empirical information via a revolutionary cloud-based platform to authoritative figures in commercial, environmental, and humanitarian sectors. We are both a space company and data company all rolled into one. Customers and users across the globe use Planet's data to develop new technologies, drive revenue, power research, and solve our worlds toughest obstacles. As we control every component of hardware design, manufacturing, data processing, and software engineering, our office is a truly inspiring mix of experts from a variety of domains. We have a people-centric approach toward culture and community and we are iterating in a way that puts our team members first and prepares our company for growth. Join Planet and be a part of our mission to change the way people see the world. Planet is headquartered in San Francisco, California, Earth. Impact Youll Own Our Payload team enables the generation of accurate products from Planetscope satellites. There are multiple methods used to characterize image quality and ensure accuracy from celestial maneuvers to examination of earth-facing on-orbit imagery. The work of the Payload team is performed at scale and affects millions of images and terabytes of data. There is much work to be done and would be a great experience for an up-and-coming engineer who has experience with characterization of optical systems. Impact You'll Own Improving the monitoring of radiometric calibration using a reference moon irradiance model Using celestial images for imaging system characterization Characterization of imaging systems at the optical and radiometric level using on-orbit data Developing software for automation of image analysis that will work at scale and be reliable for a production pipeline Writing about the research performed so that it can be presented in scientific papers or conferences Optimizing data storage and processing in high-performance computing (HPC) and commercial cloud (AWS, GCP, etc.) environments What You Bring BS (current or recent student) in Computer Science, Civil Engineering, Science Math What Makes You Stand Out MS Some Press About Us Our CEO, Will Marshall featured on and at a recent Bloomberg Businessweek video Planet Blog Why we care so much about Belonging. Were dedicated to helping the whole Planet, and to do that we must strive to represent all of it within each of our offices and on all of our teams. Thats why Planet is guided by an ultimate north star of Belonging, dreaming big as we approach our with diversity, equity and inclusion. If this job intrigues you, but youre thinking you might not have all the qualifications, please... do apply! At Planet, we are looking for well-rounded people from who can contribute to more ways than just what is listed in this job description. We dont just fill positions, we fulfill peoples careers and find folks that are motivated by our underlying humanitarian efforts. We are a few orbits around the sun before we get to where we want to be, so we hope youre excited to come along for the ride.

position: Business Intelligence Analyst Intern (Systems Analyst / Business Analyst Internship)
description:
Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst Intern

(Systems Analyst / Business Analyst / Data Analyst / Data Architect / Information Technology Analyst / Database Administrator Internship)




Firm Overview and Position Summary:

Duart Mull is an Atlanta-based investor that takes an active role in assisting its portfolio companies in their strategic growth plans. The primary focus of the Duart Mull team is working as a consultant partner to its portfolio companies in order to identify opportunities to connect management to the information that helps them make better decisions. In order to support the growth of its portfolio companies, Duart Mull is seeking to add a Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst Intern to the team to design and implement systems and processes to (1) support dashboarding, operating analytics, and ad hoc analysis projects to aid strategic decisions and (2) streamline automation and back-office processes. This position is a unique opportunity to work with the private equity capital partner of an exciting variety of growth-stage companies. If you are seeking a very challenging and rewarding environment in which to grow your skills and experience in a broad range of high-growth companies, this may be a fit for you.




The skillset required for this role is heavily concentrated in relational databases, third-party RESTful APIs, and the various tools that connect to data sources in order to analyze operations/transaction data and create dashboards, reports, and visualizations for management oversight and business process optimization. The successful candidate must have a solid understanding of relational databases, proficiency in SQL, experience in the extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) of various data sources, familiarity in REST or SOAP APIs/ web services, and strong analytic skills. In addition to the required technical skillset, extraordinary verbal and written communication abilities are also required.




As a Business Intelligence Analyst Intern, the average breakdown of time is about 60% developing methods to optimize and report on portfolio company operations, 10% researching various aspects of prospective investment targets’ operations and systems, 15% executing weekly and monthly ETL tasks required for financial reporting/operational accounting functions, and 15% working in Duart Mull’s internal operations. Most activities involve connecting to each companies’ ERP/CRM systems and to third party APIs as data sources and normalizing data in order to create data models, reports, visualizations, real-time dashboards, and to facilitate data import and transfer functions between systems. The typical areas of focus include defining and optimizing customer acquisition processes, analyzing and presenting operations data, making marketing analytics actionable, development and execution of data flows between financial reporting & accounting systems, systems development, and technology selection.




The technologies/tools typically employed are SQL, Microsoft Excel, Power Query, Power BI, Microsoft Dynamics CRM, Salesforce, and Microsoft SharePoint. Prior experience in software development/ coding and database design is considered favorably in evaluation of skills. An existing expert-level knowledge of Excel is required and a willingness to learn the tactical administrative functions of SharePoint, Microsoft Dynamics CRM, prevalent general ledger systems like Quickbooks and Microsoft Dynamics GP is a requirement if those skills are not already in place.




Required Education and Experience:

Enrolled in or recently completed a 4 Year Degree program from a top-tier campus-based university.

Preferred Undergraduate Major in management information systems, computer science, engineering, business administration, accounting, finance, mathematics, or relevant analytical discipline

2+ years of analysis or information technology experience in an academic and/or business environment.




Required Skills:

Strong Quantitative Analysis and Numeric Reasoning.
Advanced/Expert level in Microsoft Excel.
Proficiency in relational database design and Entity Relationship Diagrams (ERD).
Proficiency in Structured Query Language (SQL).
Prior experience/Familiarity with Business Intelligence (BI) tools such as Microsoft Power BI or Tableau.
Intermediate level in JSON or XML.
Intermediate level in RESTful or SOAP APIs/ web services.
Intermediate level in HTML.
Prior experience/Familiarity in software development/coding using one of the following languages: JavaScript/ Java, PHP, Python, Visual Basic, C/C++, PEARL, or ASP.net.
Natural English ability to expertly communicate verbally and in written form to a diverse and non-technical audience.
Ability to learn and apply complex technical information quickly.
Ability to work and excel on multiple projects in a fast-paced environment.
High level of independence, assertiveness, and decisiveness.




Desired Experience:(Not necessarily required.)

Microsoft Azure, MS SQL Server, and Cloud-based Data Warehousing.
Microsoft CRM and/or Salesforce.
Microsoft Power Query (M) and Microsoft Data Analysis Expressions (DAX).
Microsoft Visual Basic for Applications (VBA).
Knowledge of accounting and finance.




Beyond just education, skills, & experience:

You are honest and trustworthy.
You have an authentic passion for making businesses better and providing value to your teammates.
You are obsessed with numbers, a logical thinker, but also enjoy the opportunity to be creative.
You are a process person who plans obsessively and has the skills and background to prove it.
You are flexible and work hard and expect the same of your teammates.
You are curious, open-minded, and love the challenge of learning something new every day.

Paid Internship commensurate with prior experience and credentials

About Verkada

At Verkada, we’re rethinking what it means to be physically safe. Today, we build security cameras that detect action, identify danger and help keep people and places safe and secure. Using a combination of software and hardware, we’re transforming an industry that has seen little innovation for decades—and we already support thousands of customers. But this is just the beginning. We envision a world in which security systems feel as seamless and modern as the organizations they protect and our enterprise solution becomes a model for not just business security, but public security as well.

Verkada is seeking Cloud Security Interns who are passionate about cloud networking and IoT to provide troubleshooting, design, and integration assistance to our growing base of enterprise customers. Interns work on the same issues and projects as our full-time Cloud Security Engineers, so if you are interested in making an impact and learning valuable career skills in a highly technical real-world environment, come join us.

Responsibilities

Troubleshoot network, hardware and software issues related to the Verkada platform
Provide best practice design and integration expertise to customers
Communicate technical matters to customers both orally and in writing
Own customer issues from creation to resolution
Collaborate with Engineering and Product teams to test new products and features and fix bugs
Contribute content to our Knowledge Base
Lab testing and team projects


Requirements

Third or Fourth year college student working towards a Bachelor’s or Master's degree in a related technical discipline: Networking, Telecommunications, Systems Administration, Information Technology, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Cyber Security from an accredited 4-year college.
Coursework with a focus on computer networking, Linux, and computer systems.
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills.
Demonstrated problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Ability to work within a team environment.
Industry certifications are a plus: CCNP, CCNA, CCNET, CWNP, CWNA, Network+.


About Our Team

Behind the scenes, we’re a team of computer scientists, hardware engineers and experienced founders who saw a chance to make a real impact. We’re united by the challenge of building beautiful products, designed for real people—and by our commitment to using technology responsibly. We believe keeping data private and secure is core to our safety as individuals, businesses and communities and we put great care into building systems that embody our values as people. Likewise, many of Silicon Valley’s top investors believe in us: we’re backed by Sequoia Capital, FirstRound, Meritech and Siemens (Next47).

Verkada is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status, and encourage all qualified applicants to apply.

Likewise, many of Silicon Valley’s top investors believe in us: we’re backed by Sequoia Capital, FirstRound, Meritech and Siemens (Next47).

Verkada is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status, and encourage all qualified applicants to apply.

About Verkada

At Verkada, we’re rethinking what it means to be physically safe. Today, we build security cameras that detect action, identify danger and help keep people and places safe and secure. Using a combination of software and hardware, we’re transforming an industry that has seen little innovation for decades—and we already support thousands of customers. But this is just the beginning. We envision a world in which security systems feel as seamless and modern as the organizations they protect and our enterprise solution becomes a model for not just business security, but public security as well.

The Role

Come join one of the fastest growing startups in the Silicon Valley! Verkada is looking for Mobile Engineering interns to join our team for an exciting and challenging internship. As part of the Mobile Engineering team, you will collaborate cross functionally to support the entire mobile application lifecycle, for both existing and new applications, enabling our best-in-class security systems.

Learn more about Verkada from one of our interns - Caileen Dolan from University of Waterloo.

Responsibilities

Support the entire mobile application lifecycle (concept, design, test, and release) in a fast paced environment for both existing and new mobile applications.
Work in partnership with cross-functional teams to elaborate, design, and implement new features.
Work in iterative sprints to design, develop, and test solutions.
Build automation and tests to streamline development.


Requirements

Ability to work from September 2020 - December 2020.
Actively pursuing a degree in Computer Science (or similar degree plan).
Proficient understanding of Swift and iOS SDK or Kotlin and Android SDK.
Experience writing multi-threaded, asynchronous code.
Experience working with backend server APIs.
Solid UI development and unit testing skills.
Solid understanding of fundamental Computer Science concepts.
Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work well alongside engineers of all levels.


About Our Team

Behind the scenes, we’re a team of computer scientists, hardware engineers and experienced founders who saw a chance to make a real impact. We’re united by the challenge of building beautiful products, designed for real people—and by our commitment to using technology responsibly. We believe keeping data private and secure is core to our safety as individuals, businesses and communities and we put great care into building systems that embody our values as people. Likewise, many of Silicon Valley’s top investors believe in us: we’re backed by Sequoia Capital, FirstRound, Meritech and Siemens (Next47).

Verkada is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status, and encourage all qualified applicants to apply.

If you are interested in a career in an IT department, we want to meet you!

Experience with Windows 7, 8, & 10
Customer service oriented with problem solving abilities and adaptability skills


About Us

We are Real Green Systems, a leading Michigan enterprise software company. We provide software solutions to lawn care, pest control, and other types of organizations in the green industry. We believe that success is achieved through the pursuit of excellence in customer and employee relations. We keep “a finger on the pulse” of our company by staying tuned in with the status of our customers and the well-being of our Real Green family of employees. We strive to exceed expectations by providing exceptional products and services that are innovative, affordable and meets the needs of our service industry partners. You can learn more about us at

Our Culture

Real Green Systems is a respectful, family-friendly company. We are proud of our culture and of the dedication of our employees. Many of our employees have been here for years and the organization is very loyal to them, providing ample opportunity to learn on the job along with a great place to work.

Convenient Walled Lake, MI location

Alkami builds and delivers the nation’s most innovative cloud-based digital banking (online and mobile apps) for Credit Unions and Banks with over 6M users on our platform. Through our bold investments in technology and people, our clients confidently grow, adapt quickly and build thriving digital banking communities to compete against the Megabanks. Founded 10 years ago with headquarters in Plano, Alkami is one of the fastest growing software companies in Texas and among the fastest growing privately held technology companies in the U.S. To share just a few of our recent recognitions: Best Place to Work in Fintech; Inc. 500 America’s Fastest-Growing Private Companies; Deloitte Technology Fast 500; Tech Titans Top 5; and, SMU Cox Caruth Institute Dallas 100. With every Alkamist having ownership in Alkami, we are obsessively intentional about our culture: optimistic-perseverance, caring-collaboration, transparent-communication, courageous-innovation, trusted-accountability and real-fun. Beyond intentional culture, our commitment is to attract and retain amazing talent by fostering a high-growth, dynamic and rewarding environment; providing great benefits; making meaningful investments in learning and development; offering free lunches every work day; celebrating our successes together in remarkable ways; and, ACTing together by taking time to give back and volunteer.

Position Overview

This is an internship or coop position (July 2020 - December 2020). As an Application Security Intern, you will work side-by-side with other engineers and analysts to perform analysis of our platform code to ensure it is free of defects and vulnerabilities. You will have the opportunity to use and enhance your knowledge of application security vulnerabilities, communications technologies, computing platforms, security protocols and penetration testing.

Note: Knowledge of a structured programming language (e.g. C# .Net, Python) is a core need for this position. Application Security expertise, while helpful if you have it, is not a requirement.

Key Responsibilities & Duties

Scan code using automated code scanning tools
Perform code reviews for code written in one or more of C#, .NET MVC, JavaScript, Java (Android) and/or Swift (iOS).
Create and execute system tests to ensure package quality using a variety of test methods
Conduct and source code review tests using third party products
Work with internal teams to validate remediation efforts for identified coding issues.
Document and research issues discovered
Assist with providing documented release packages
Other duties as assigned



Qualifications

Hands on experience of at least one programming language e.g. Python, C#, .Net.
Must be available to work up to 20 hours per week during the entire internship period beginning July 2020 and ending December 2020, with the potential for renewed engagement for additional semesters.
Must be commutable to and from the North Plano, TX area for the duration of the internship period
Understanding of basic networking concepts and protocols like TCP/IP, UDP etc.
Experience with MS Visual Studio, Android Studio or Xcode
Must be authorized to work in the United States and not require sponsorship in the future



Desired Skills

Currently enrolled in a college or university working toward a Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or a closely related field; or enrolled or completed a Per Scholas program
Must be responsible, self-motivated, creative, and have a solid work ethic and have a desire to produce a quality product
Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to articulate work at different levels of the organization
Solid analytical problem-solving skills
Inquisitive individual with a student mentality possessing a long term desire to work in the software development space
Ability to prioritize tasks and handle numerous assignments concurrently
Positive, personable, and able to work cohesively with other across various divisions
Able to work independently as well as within a team


Cool Things to Know

Not Just Any Company: Alkami has an awesome diverse and inclusive environment. We have a FUN culture and offer great benefits. Did you know every Alkamist has ownership in Alkami? We also have on and off site employee events and activities.
Free Lunch: Who said there is no free lunch? At Alkami, every day we offer free lunch
Relocation: Unfortunately we don't offer relocation assistance. We are ready for you to contribute from our super cool Plano, TX location.
Work Authorization: We cannot offer employer sponsorship at this time; candidates must be eligible to work in the US for full-time employment.
Recruiters: We are not looking for outside recruiting firms to help us in this search — we know who you are and we love you, but we don’t need you right now.

The Important Stuff

Alkami Technology is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: Alkami is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Alkami are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Alkami will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Alkami encourages applicants of all ages.

Job Description

Altanova is now actively hiring for open Energy Engineer internship positions in our New York office.

Successful applicants will have the capability to progressively conduct site surveys, perform quantitative analysis to support advanced modeling / computer simulation, research and understand new technologies / processes and prepare reports detailing analytical findings. Also, candidates with the ability to work in a team and to learn quickly in an environment requiring both strong theoretical and analytical background with deep pragmatism are encouraged to apply.

Requirements

Education

A Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering, Physics or equivalent.
A Master's degree or current enrollment in a higher education program is a plus.
Outstanding Bachelor's students in their final year will also be considered.


Skills

Excellent communication, writing, and computer skills are mandatory
Top academic or professional energy efficiency engineering experience with industrial manufacturing operations, commercial building systems or building energy modeling
Experience in at least one of the following areas:
Energy Efficiency and Building Energy Modeling and Simulation (EQuest/DOE2 or EnergyPlus)
Analytical Modeling, Analysis and Comprehensive Energy Assessment
Building Science: Envelope and HVAC System Assessment
High Performance Buildings including LEED, Living Building Challenge, Passive House, Well Building Standard
Industrial Process Efficiency and Productivity
Renewable Energy Technologies (photovoltaics, wind, distributed generation, etc.)

Altanova offers an initial compensation starting at $2,600/month. Depending on qualifications and potential, this pay will evolve quickly. The internship is on a full-time basis (40 hours/week), but a part-time internship may be possible depending on the candidate's availability.

About ALTANOVA: Altanova is a boutique consulting firm founded in 2006 and based in New York City. We combine strategic and technological analysis to further the sustainable performance of clients' assets, operations and reputation. Our clients are a mix of real estate, corporate clients and investors whom we have worked with on over 300 projects, covering 40,000,000FT 2in 31 countries.

ALTANOVA has a long-standing commitment to providing equal employment opportunity to all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, veteran status, political belief, or any other basis protected by applicable law. Our staff is a strong illustration of this commitment.

Join our diverse team of engineers, scientists and business experts and help find innovative solutions to pressing sustainability challenges. Further your career in an energetic and collaborative environment where our shared passion is ensuring our clients achieve sustainable growth. For more about us, visit altanova.io.

About Us

With electric vehicles (EV's) expected to be 25% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint is at the center of this revolution, powering the world’s leading EV charging network and most complete set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every EV charging need. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a reality globally.

Our fanatical focus on charging and 10+ years in business has made us an industry leader. Supported by $538 million from investors including American Electric Power, Canada Pension Plan Investment Board, Chevron Technology Ventures, Clearvision, Daimler Trucks & Buses, GIC, Quantum Energy Partners, BMW i Ventures, Braemar Energy Ventures, Linse Capital, and Siemens, ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime chance to be part of creating an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market. Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.

Discover what it’s like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.

Reports To

Sr. Director, Quality and Technical Ops

What You Will Be Doing

This Intern will work in the operations department to help establish consistent manufacturing process instruction sets for ISO and pilot a product end user testing process. We plan to utilize his minor in computer science minor to help program and update our manufacturing execution system for part and assembly traceability. The estimated duration will be Jun, 2020 – Sep, 2020.

What You Will Bring to ChargePoint

Quality Data: Define and demine the best way to link Factory, Field, and Customer Support metrics from the multiple sources
Metrics Dashboard: Work with India team to finish Quality KPI dashboards
MPI: standardize and update MPIs at various sites to align with ISO
End User Testing: establish end user testing process for CP, and pilot with a product
FRU testing Procedure and Tracking: Formalize a FRU validation process before ship out
Automated Inspection: leveraging googles ML solution to looks at replacing In Process Quality Checks


Location

Campbell, CA

We are committed to an inclusive and diverse team. ChargePoint is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any legally protected status.

If there is a match between your experiences/skills and the Company needs, we will contact you directly.

ChargePoint is an equal opportunity employer.
Applicants only - Recruiting agencies do not contact.

This is a 3-6 month full-time internship opening ---

Do you love data?

Are you passionate about driving business insights using visualizations?

Do you excel at designing and implementing complex data pipelines and automations necessary to keep a high tech startup thriving?

We Are Looking For a Driven, Independent, Data Analyst Intern To Join The Data Science Team And Work On The Following Tasks

Tableau dashboard design and maintenance
Data pipeline implementation and maintenance
Dataset creation, curation, and organization
Day to day user and customer analytics


Applicants Must Have

Proficiency in Tableau and Python is a MUST
A degree in computer science or related field
1 year minimum track record in applying analytics and data engineering to real world problems

Neustar is an information services and technology company and a leader in identity resolution providing the data and technology that enables trusted connections between companies and people at the moments that matter most. More information is available at .

Job Requisition:R-3184 Intern (Open)

Primary Location:ROCHESTER

Job Description

Job Description:

Who are we?
As a company built on the foundation of Privacy by Design, for more than 20 years Neustar's unique capabilities have made us the leader in the field of responsible identity resolution. Neustar enables trusted connections between companies and people at the moments that matter the most, with world-class and industry leading solutions in Marketing, Risk, Communications, Security and Registry services.

Job Description

Neustar is in the process of expanding the capabilities of its automated pipeline that supports its Data Onboarding business. As part of this effort, we are continuing to add support for new platform integrations and enhancing existing ones. The engineer in this role will be responsible for building new integration code (both file-based and API-based) as well as making improvements to the existing integration codebase. New integrations often require implementing client-side APIs to support delivery of data as well as management of metadata. The engineer will also be responsible for creating new and improving existing unit and integration tests.

There will also be opportunities to work in a Big Data environment for supporting new pipeline workflows and generating statistics for reporting purposes.

Job Duties

Implementation of client-side APIs.
Improving existing integration code to better surface error information
Generate statistics for reporting purposes

Qualifications/Education

In degree program for Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field
Java
Ability to work in a Linux environment
Familiarity with relational databases and SQL
Self-motivated and detail-oriented
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

Additional Information

Big Data technologies (Hadoop, Hive, Pig, Map Reduce, Spark)
Scripting languages (Bash, Perl, Python, etc.)
Git

At Neustar, we are committed to the growth and development of our employees whose individual skills, curiosity and passion for their work, contribute to the overall success of our business. Our core values (Accountability, Collaboration, Transparency, Resilience, and Respect) are the driving force of our culture across our locations around the globe. We offer our employees a comprehensive benefits package including perks such as tuition reimbursement, awesome company discounts, back-up day care, community service events, pet and baby swag and much more! We are all learning and creating together; and having some major fun along the way.

JOIN US! We can't wait to meet you!

Neustar does not accept unsolicited resumes from external firms or agencies. Neustar will not be responsible for placement fees associated with unsolicited resumes.

DIVERSITY
Diversity, inclusion and teamwork are second nature to Neustar; and these values permeate our entire business structure. Neustar is committed to creating an environment where a wide spectrum of opinions and beliefs are actively sought, listened to and respected. Further, our talented workforce draws from the many geographic areas and markets in which Neustar operates worldwide, which represents a distinct competitive advantage. The rich and varied personal and professional backgrounds of our employees make Neustar a dynamic and rewarding company at which to build a career. We invite you to join us.

Job Title: Information Technology Intern

Location: Washington, DC

Clearance Required: Eligibility for a Government Agency Specific Clearance - US Citizenship Required

About 1901 Group

1901 Group is a creative, high energy company shaping the future of how organizations monitor and manage their IT environment. 1901 Group provides innovative IT services using a cloud-based platform that enables monitoring, management, and optimization of our customer’s IT environments regardless if their assets are in the cloud, on-premise, or in both. Our services are delivered using an a “as a service” model (XaaS) embedding all of the people, processes and technology necessary to deliver highly efficient IT services on a 24x7x365 basis. With this great offering, has come great success so we need passionate, innovative people who love working with technology and are ready to make an impact.

Purpose Of Job

The highly motivated independent individual will be responsible for supporting the United States Holocaust Memorial Museum (USHMM) on weekends to turn the Museum’s public facing exhibits on and off and to and provide help desk support to USHMM employees.

Key Responsibilities

Help support the Museum’s public facing display areas by performing weekend turn on and shut down of public facing displays and exhibits
Follow documented processes precisely to ensure correct operation of display systems
Notify manager and client points of contact of any issues and failures identified during turn on and shut down activities
Provide hands-on system help desk support for Museum customers.
Answer customer calls reporting computer incidents and service requests.
Support end user software and hardware requests and installations.
Troubleshoot incidents to resolution and identify root cause; escalate to Senior Desktop Technicians and Engineers
Create tickets and manage incidents, service requests, and problems through their full life-cycle
Update tickets and continuously coordinate necessary work


Required Skills

0 - 1 years of help desk or desktop support or similar IT experience
0 – 1 years of Tier I phone support
Basic understanding of video display systems and projectors
Proficiency with troubleshooting MAC OSX, Windows 7, and Windows 10 operating systems.
Proficiency with troubleshooting Laptops, Desktops, iPhone, Android, Blackberry, and Mac hardware.
Experience with PC Imaging
Basic Active Directory experience/knowledge
Methodical and detail oriented
Professional, positive, and cheerful demeanor
Strong problem solving and communication skills
Self-driven, independent, and highly motivated
Willingness to work flexible hours – shift work required including weekend shift hours
Must have high-energy work ethic and be available to work non-standard hours during peak season times


Minimum Education Required

High School Diploma or equivalent.
Pursuing undergraduate degree in Computer Science or related technical field.

The Company

Hitachi Vantara, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Hitachi, Ltd., guides our customers from what’s now to what’s next by solving their digital challenges. Working alongside each customer, we apply our unmatched industrial and digital capabilities to their data and applications to benefit both business and society. More than 80% of the Fortune 100 trust Hitachi Vantara to help them develop new revenue streams, unlock competitive advantages, lower costs, enhance customer experiences, and deliver social and environmental value.

The Position

We are looking for a hands-on Data Scientist for summer internship as part of the Analytics team in the IoT & Analytics CTO office of Hitachi Vantara North America. The role will be either based in Waltham, MA or remote home office.

The responsibility

Develop the Automated Machine Learning tool – AutoDEPPA2, which is to automate the generic components in each step of DEPPA process: Descriptive, Exploratory, Predictive, Prescriptive, Automation and Autonomous.
Research, understand and evaluate a wide range of machine learning techniques and tools from public resources (papers, blogs, Github, etc). Techniques and tools may include but not limited to: data engineering, data analysis, machine learning modeling, reinforcement learning, meta-learning, cohort learning, deep learning, etc.
Present the tools to internal teams and perform technical discussions
Incorporate the selected tools into AuotDEPPA2 by following the existing code structure.
Build models (like meta learning models) as part of the AutoDEPPA2 work.
Collect data for different domains from public resources (like Kaggle)
